entry.title: Lecture Notes on Free Probability
entry.summary: Lecture notes for a graduate course lectured at Stanford University.

entry.title: The noise of a Brownian sticky flow is black
entry.summary: In this note, it is proved that the noise (in the sense of Tsirelson) generated by a Brownian sticky flow (as defined in math.PR/0211387) is black.

entry.title: Small noise asymptotic of the timing jitter in soliton transmission
entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn because it is a duplicate of [math.PR/0609434].

entry.title: Further examples with moments of Gamma type
entry.summary: This is an appendix containing further examples to S. Janson, Moments of Gamma type and the Brownian supremum process area, arXiv:1002.4135 [math.PR] and Probability Surveys 7 (2010), 1-52.

entry.title: Brownian local minima, random dense countable sets and random equivalence classes
entry.summary: A random dense countable set is characterized (in distribution) by independence and stationarity. Two examples are `Brownian local minima' and `unordered infinite sample'. They are identically distributed. A framework for such concepts, proposed here, includes a wide class of random equivalence classes.

entry.title: Free probability for probabilists
entry.summary: This is an introduction to some of the most probabilistic aspects of free probability theory.

entry.title: q-probability: I. Basic discrete distributions
entry.summary: For basic discrete probability distributions, $-$ Bernoulli, Pascal, Poisson, hypergeometric, contagious, and uniform, $-$ $q$-analogs are proposed.

entry.title: Modelling of stock price changes: a real analysis approach
entry.summary: The paper discusses a path-wise approach to stock price modelling.

entry.title: A new property of absorbed diffusions
entry.summary: We consider stochastic diffusion processes absorbed at the boundary of a domain. It is shown that there exist initial distributions which ensure a given decreasing of density of the absorbed process.

entry.title: percolation on finite graphs
entry.summary: The asymptotic study of percolation on finite transitive graphs is considered. Several questions and very few answers regarding percolation on finite graphs are presented.

entry.title: Selfsimilar random fractal measure using contraction method in probabilistic metric spaces
entry.summary: We use contraction method in probabilistic metric spaces to prove existence and uniqueness of selfsimilar random fractal measures.

entry.title: Brownian Bridge and Self-Avoiding Random Walk
entry.summary: We establish the Brownian bridge asymptotics for a scaled self-avoiding walk conditioned on arriving to a far away point $n \vec{a}$ for $\vec{a}$ in $Z^d$, as $n$ increases to infinity.

entry.title: Scaling limit of loop erased random walk - a naive approach
entry.summary: We give an alternative proof of the existence of the scaling limit of loop erased random walk which does not use Lowner's differential equation.

entry.title: Girsanov Theorem for Filtered Poisson Processes
entry.summary: Shot-noise and fractional Poisson processes are instances of filtered Poisson processes. We here prove Girsanov theorem for this kind of processes and give an application to an estimate problem.

entry.title: On some inequalities for Gaussian measures
entry.summary: We review several inequalities concerning Gaussian measures - isoperimetric inequality, Ehrhard's inequality, Bobkov's inequality, S-inequality and correlation conjecture.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 2, 813--822

entry.title: Toeplitz determinants, random growth and determinantal processes
entry.summary: We summarize some of the recent developments which link certain problems in combinatorial theory related to random growth to random matrix theory.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 53--62

entry.title: A non constructive proof of the existence of a maximal irreducibility measure
entry.summary: We deduce the existence of a maximal irreducibility measure for a Markov chain from Zorn's lemma.

entry.title: Slab percolation for the Ising model
entry.summary: For the FK representation of the Ising model, we prove that the slab percolation threshold coincides with the critical temperature in any dimension larger or equal to three.

entry.title: Multitype Contact Process with Frozen states
entry.summary: We study a generalization of the two colors multitype contact process intended to mimic an example of interspecific competition called allelopathy.

entry.title: Covariance matrices of self-affine measures
entry.summary: In this paper we derive a formula for a covariance matrix of any self-affine measure.

entry.title: Sojourn times for Brownian sheet
entry.summary: This paper is dedicated to Professor Endre Csakion the occasion of his 65th birthday.

entry.title: Correction Bounds on measures satisfying moment conditions
entry.summary: The Annals of Applied Probability (2002) 12 1114-1137

entry.title: Symmetric stable processes in parabola--shaped regions
entry.summary: We identify the critical exponent of integrability of the first exit time of rotation invariant stable L\'evy process from parabola--shaped region.

entry.title: Exponential Bounds for Random Sums
entry.summary: We construct a non - improved exponential bounds for distribution of normed sums of i.,i.d. random variables with random numbers of summand.

entry.title: Law of Large Numbers for a Class of Superdiffusions
entry.summary: Under spectral conditions, we prove a LLN type result for superdiffusions, where the convergence is meant in probability. The main tool is a space-time H-transformation.

entry.title: Limit raring proceses with apllication
entry.summary: This paper deals with study of the sufficient condition of approximation raring process with mixing by renewall process. We consider use the proved results to practice problem too

entry.title: An invariance principle for Azéma martingales
entry.summary: An invariance principle for Az\'{e}ma martingales is presented as well as a new device to construct solutions of Emery's structure equations.

entry.title: No multiple collisions for mutually repelling Brownian particles
entry.summary: Brownian particles in electrostatic interaction may pairwise collide when the interaction parameter is small. But multiple collisions are never possible.

entry.title: The Probability of a Run
entry.summary: We prove the explicit formula for the probability of a run of r successes in n trials.

entry.title: Feller Processes on non-locally compact spaces
entry.summary: We introduce the ergodic condition which assures the existence of an invariant measure for Feller processes defined on an arbitrary complete and separable metric space.

entry.title: Localization transition for a copolymer in an emulsion
entry.summary: In this paper we study a two-dimensional directed self-avoiding walk model of a random copolymer in a random emulsion.

entry.title: Flow properties of differential equations driven by fractional Brownian motion
entry.summary: We prove that solutions of stochastic differential equations driven by fractional Brownian motion for $H>1/2$ define flows of homeomorphisms on $\mathbb{R}^{d}$.

entry.title: A note on the Menchov-Rademacher Inequality
entry.summary: We improve constants in the Rademacher-Menchov inequality.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bulletin of the Polish Academy; Vol. 54, No. 1, 2006

entry.title: Constrained exchangeable partitions
entry.summary: For a class of random partitions of an infinite set a de Finetti-type representation is derived, and in one special case a central limit theorem for the number of blocks is shown.

entry.title: The small-time behaviour of diffusion and time-changed diffusion processes on the line
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: $L^p$ properties for Gaussian random series
entry.summary: We study L^p properties of Gaussian random series with particular attention to the case of radial functions.

entry.title: A simple proof of a recurrence theorem for random walks in $\Z^{2}$
entry.summary: In this note, we prove without using Fourier analysis that the symmetric square integrable random walks in $\Z^{2}$ are recurrent.

entry.title: An Extension to Gaussian Semigroup and Some Applications
entry.summary: We look at the semigroup generated by a system of heat equations. Applications to testing normality and option pricing are addressed.

entry.title: The Riff-Shuffle Distribution is Unimodal
entry.summary: We show that the probability mass function of the riff-shuffle distribution, also known as the minimum negative binomial distribution, is unimodal, but in general not log-concave.

entry.title: Gaussian fluctuations for βEnsembles
entry.summary: We study the Circular and Jacobi $\beta$-Ensembles and prove Gaussian fluctuations for the number of points in one or more intervals in the macroscopic scaling limit.

entry.title: Une nouvelle condition d'independance pour le theoreme de la limite centrale
entry.summary: We prove a central limit theorem with aassumptions which are many weak than classical conditions

entry.title: On a theorem in multi-parameter potential theory
entry.summary: We prove a theorem on additive Levy processes and give applications

entry.title: On a general theorem for additive Levy processes
entry.summary: We prove a new theorem on additive Levy processes and show that this theorem implies several proved theorems and a hard conjectured theorem.

entry.title: Hausdorrf dimension for level sets and k-multiple times
entry.summary: We compute the Hausdorff dimension of the zero set of an additive Levy process.

entry.title: Malliavin calculus of Bismut type without probability
entry.summary: We translate in semigroup theory Bismut's way of the Malliavin calculus.

entry.title: Hoeffding's inequality in game-theoretic probability
entry.summary: This note makes the obvious observation that Hoeffding's original proof of his inequality remains valid in the game-theoretic framework. All details are spelled out for the convenience of future reference.

entry.title: Maximal regularity for stochastic convolutions driven by Levy noise
entry.summary: We show that the result from Da Prato and Lunardi is valid for stochastic convolutions driven by L\'evy processes.

entry.title: Moderate deviations for random fields and random complex zeroes
entry.summary: Moderate deviations for random complex zeroes are deduced from a new theorem on moderate deviations for random fields.

entry.title: Markov loops and renormalization
entry.summary: We study Poissonian ensembles of Markov loops and the associated renormalized self-intersection local times.

entry.title: Relationship between stochastic flows and connection forms
entry.summary: In this article I will prove new representation for the Levi-Civita connection in terms of the stochastic flow corresponding to Brownian motion on manifold.

entry.title: Moment problems and boundaries of number triangles
entry.summary: The boundary problem for graphs like Pascal's but with general multiplicities of edges is related to a `backward' problem of moments of the Hausdorff type.

entry.title: Les deux quadrangulations infinies uniformes ont même loi
entry.summary: We prove that the uniform infinite random quadrangulations introduced respectively by Chassaing-Durhuus and Krikun have the same distribution.

entry.title: Itô's formula for the $L_{p}$-norm of stochastic $W^{1}_{p}$-valued processes
entry.summary: We prove It\^o's formula for the $L_{p}$-norm of a stochastic $W^{1}_{p}$-valued processes appearing in the theory of SPDEs in divergence form.

entry.title: A short proof and a generalization of the BKR-inequality
entry.summary: There is a serious mistake in the proof.
entry.arxiv:comment: There is a serious mistake in the proof

entry.title: Poisson Limit for Associated Random Fields
entry.summary: We prove that under an easily verifiable set of conditions a sequence of associated random fields converges under rescaling to the Poisson Point Process and give a couple of examples.

entry.title: Some Notes on Standard Borel and Related Spaces
entry.summary: These notes give an elementary approach to parts of the theory of standard Borel and analytic spaces.

entry.title: An Upper Bound on the critical density for Activated Random Walks on Euclidean Lattices
entry.summary: We show the critical density for activated random walks on Euclidean lattices is at most one.

entry.title: Fast approximation of solutions of SDE's with oblique reflection on an orthant
entry.summary: We consider the discrete "fast" penalization scheme for SDE's driven by general semimartingale on orthant $\mathbb{R}_{+}^{d}$ with oblique reflection.

entry.title: Lowering and raising operators for the free Meixner class of orthogonal polynomials
entry.summary: We compare some properties of the lowering and raising operators for the classical and free classes of Meixner polynomials on the real line.

entry.title: A passage to the Poisson-Dirichlet through the Bessel square processes
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Loss networks
entry.summary: We review the theory of loss networks, including recent results on their dynamical behaviour. We give also some new results.

entry.title: Heat kernel of fractional Laplacian in cones
entry.summary: We give sharp estimates for the transition density of the isotropic stable L\'evy process killed when leaving a right circular cone.

entry.title: Random Walks on Dicyclic Group
entry.summary: This paper works out the rate of convergence of two "natural" random walks on the dicyclic group.

entry.title: On the distribution of the integral of the exponential Brownian motion
entry.summary: The density distribution function of the integral of the exponential Brownian motion is determined explicitly in the form of a rapidly convergent series.

entry.title: Computations of Greeks in stochastic volatility models via the Malliavin calculus
entry.summary: We compute Greeks for stochastic volatility models driven by Brownian informations. We use the Malliavin method introduced for deterministic volatility models.

entry.title: Quasi-martingales with a linearly ordered index set
entry.summary: We prove a version of Rao decomposition for quasi-martingales indexed by a linearly ordered set.

entry.title: The triangle and the open triangle
entry.summary: We show that for percolation on any transitive graph, the triangle condition implies the open triangle condition.

entry.title: Large Deviation in Harnack type Dirichlet spaces
entry.summary: In the framework of Harnack type Dirichlet forms, we prove a large deviation principle for the asymptotics of reversible Markov processes with rate function given by the energy of the paths.

entry.title: Limit theorems for random processes with random time substitution
entry.summary: In this paper the sufficient conditions for convergence in Skorokhod space $D[0,1]$ of sequence of random processes with random time substitution are obtained.

entry.title: On Khintchine inequalities with a weight
entry.summary: In this note we prove a weighted version of the Khintchine inequalities.

entry.title: Stability of the Prékopa-Leindler inequality
entry.summary: We prove a stability version of the Pr\'ekopa-Leindler inequality.

entry.title: Orthogonality and probability: mixing times
entry.summary: We produce the first example of bounding total variation distance to stationarity and estimating mixing times via orthogonal polynomials diagonalization of discrete reversible Markov chains, the Karlin-McGregor approach.

entry.title: Diffusive limits on the Penrose tiling
entry.summary: In this paper random walks on the Penrose lattice are investigated. Heat kernel estimates and the invariance principle are shown.

entry.title: Asymptotic expansion of Markov random evolution
entry.summary: Is studied asymptotic expansion for solution of singularly perturbed equation for Markov random evolution in Rd. The views of regular and singular parts of solution are found.

entry.title: Distribution Function of Markovian Random Evolution in Rn
entry.summary: Obvious view of distribution function of Markovian random evolution is found in terms of Bessel functions of n+1-th order.

entry.title: Determinantal point processes
entry.summary: We present a list of algebraic, combinatorial, and analytic mechanisms that give rise to determinantal point processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a contribution to the Oxford Handbook of Random Matrix Theory

entry.title: A short proof of Cramer's theorem in R
entry.summary: We expose here a short proof of Cramer's theorem in R based on convex duality.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: The American Mathematical Monthly, Vol. 118, No. 10 (December 2011) (pp. 925-931)

entry.title: Refining quasi-probability kernels
entry.summary: We consider the problem of modifying a quasi-probability kernel in order to improve its properties without changing the set of measures whose conditional probabilities it specifies.

entry.title: The probability that a subspace contains a positive vector
entry.summary: We determine the probability that a random k-dimensional subspace of Euclidean n-space contains a positive vector.

entry.title: Some Estimates for Martingale Representation under G-Expectation
entry.summary: We provides some useful estimates for solving martingale representation problem under G-expectations. We also study the corresponding conditions for the existence and uniqueness.

entry.title: Support theorem for stochastic variational inequalities
entry.summary: We prove a support theorem of the type of Stroock-Varadhan for solutions of stochastic variational inequalities.

entry.title: The viability property of jump diffusion processes on Riemannian manifolds
entry.summary: In this note, we consider the necessary and sufficient condition for viability property of diffusion processes with jumps on closed submanifolds of $R^{m}$ with some concrete examples.

entry.title: Comparison Theorems of Infinite Horizon Forward-Backward Stochastic Differential Equations
entry.summary: By the methods of probability and duality technique, we give some comparison theorems for the solutions of infinite horizon forward-backwad stochastic differential equations.

entry.title: Wentzel-Freidlin estimates for jump processes in semi-group theory: upper bound
entry.summary: We give a translation in semi-group theory of Wentzel-Freidlin estimates for Poisson process. We consider the case of the upper bound.

entry.title: On a species survival model
entry.summary: In this paper we provide some sharp asymptotic results for a stochastic model of species survival recently proposed by Guiol, Marchado, and Schinazi.

entry.title: The Tychonoff uniqueness theorem for the G-heat equation
entry.summary: In this paper, we obtain the Tychonoff uniqueness theorem for the G-heat equation.

entry.title: Transition density estimates for jump Lévy processes
entry.summary: Upper estimates of densities of convolution semigroups of probability measures are given under explicit assumptions on the corresponding L\'evy measure and the L\'evy--Khinchin exponent.

entry.title: Helffer-Sjostrand representation for conservative dynamics
entry.summary: We consider a Helffer-Sjostrand representation for the correlations in canonical Gibbs measures with convex interactions under conservative Ginzburg-Landau dynamics. We investigate the rate of relaxation to equilibrium.

entry.title: Quadratic harnesses from generalized beta integrals
entry.summary: We use generalized beta integrals to construct examples of Markov processes with linear regressions, and quadratic second conditional moments.

entry.title: Golden-Thompson from Davis
entry.summary: We give a very short proof of the Golden-Thompson inequality

entry.title: Some results on random fields admitting a spectral representation with infinitely divisible integrator
entry.summary: We consider random fields admitting a spectral representation with infinitely divisible integrator and prove some of their properties.

entry.title: On the Dirichlet Problem
entry.summary: Using, as main tool, the convergence theorem for discrete martingales and the mean value property of harmonic functions we solve, a particular case of, Dirichlet problem.

entry.title: Between Chebyshev and Cantelli
entry.summary: A family of exact upper bounds interpolating between Chebyshev's and Cantelli's is presented.

entry.title: Uniqueness of the representation for $G$-martingales with finite variation
entry.summary: Our purpose is to prove the uniqueness of the representation for $G$-martingales with finite variation.

entry.title: Donald Burkholder's work in martingales and analysis
entry.summary: Overview of Burkholder's work on martingales and analysis

entry.title: A Nonconventional Invariance Principle for Random Fields
entry.summary: We prove a nonconventional invariance principle (functional central limit theorem) for random fields.

entry.title: An Analysis of the Min-max Algorithm
entry.summary: We consider the matrix $A_{ij}$, whose elements are independent random variables. We calculate the mean value of the number of the elements that we need to read to find $\min_i \max_j A_{ij}$.

entry.title: The Heyde Theorem on a-adic Solenoids
entry.summary: We prove the analogue of the Heyde theorem for a-adic solenoids.

entry.title: Continuity of radial and two-sided radial $SLE_κ$ at the terminal point
entry.summary: We prove that radial $SLE_\kappa$ and two-sided radial $SLE_\kappa$ are continuous at their terminal point.

entry.title: KPZ in a multidimensional random geometry of multiplicative cascades
entry.summary: We show in this note how the one-dimensional KZP formula obtained by Benjamini and Schramm can be extended to a multidimensional setting.

entry.title: Convergence to Stable Laws in Relative Entropy
entry.summary: Convergence to stable laws in relative entropy is established for sums of i.i.d. random variables.

entry.title: Large deviation for multivalued stochastic differential equations
entry.summary: We prove an large deviation principle for multivalued sdes

entry.title: Exponential Ergodicity of Non-Lipschitz Multivalued Stochastic Differential Equations
entry.summary: We prove the exponential ergodicity of the transition probabilities of solutions to elliptic multivalued stochastic differential equations.

entry.title: Chebyshev's inequality for Banach-space-valued random elements
entry.summary: In this paper, we obtain a new generalization of Chebyshev's inequality for random elements taking values in a separate Banach space.

entry.title: Update of the Borel-Cantelli Lemma
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error.

entry.title: On common roots of random Bernoulli polynomials
entry.summary: We prove that with high probability, d+1 random Bernoulli polynomials in d variables of degree n (n goes to infinity) do not possess a common root.

entry.title: Smoothness of Densities on Compact Lie Groups
entry.summary: We give necessary and sufficient conditions for both square integrability and smoothness for densities of a probability measure on a compact connected Lie group.

entry.title: A strong convergence to the Rosenblatt process
entry.summary: We give a strong approximation of Rosenblatt process via transport processes and we give the rate of convergence.

entry.title: Estimates of gradient perturbation series
entry.summary: We give upper and lower bounds of perturbation series for transition densities, corresponding to additive gradient perturbations satisfying certain space-time integrability conditions.

entry.title: An upper variance bound for the multinomial and the negative multinomial distribution
entry.summary: We prove a Chernoff-type upper variance bound for the multinomial and the negative multinomial distribution.

entry.title: Orlicz-space Hardy and Landau-Kolmogorov inequalities for Gaussian measures
entry.summary: We prove Orlicz-space versions of Hardy and Landau-Kolmogorov inequalities for Gaussian measures on the n-dimensional Euclidean space.

entry.title: Large Deviation for Reflected Backward Stochastic Differential Equations
entry.summary: In this note, we prove the Freidlin-Wentzell's large deviation principle for BSDEs with one-sided reflection.

entry.title: Moment and Tail Inequalities for Polynomial Martingales
entry.summary: In this paper we obtain the non-asymptotic exact moment and tails estimates for polynomial on martingale differences. We give also some examples on order to show the exactness of obtained results.

entry.title: Discrete Stein characterizations and discrete information distances
entry.summary: We construct two different Stein characterizations of discrete distributions and use these to provide a natural connection between Stein characterizations for discrete distributions and discrete information functionals.

entry.title: Multidimensional Probabilistic Rearrangement Invariant Spaces: A New Approach
entry.summary: We introduce and investigate in this paper a new convenient method of introduction of a norm in the multidimensional rearrangement probability invariant space.

entry.title: Resolvent metrics and heat kernel estimates
entry.summary: Resolvent metrics are generalization of the resistance metric and provide unified treatment of heat kernel estimates of sub-Gaussian type under minimal conditions.

entry.title: On the exponential ergodicity for Lévy driven Ornstein-Uhlenbeck processes
entry.summary: Based on the explicit coupling property, the ergodicity and the exponential ergodicity of L\'{e}vy driven Ornstein-Uhlenbeck processes are established.

entry.title: Moderate deviations on different scales: no relations
entry.summary: An example of a discrete-time stationary random process whose sums follow the normal approximation within a given part of the region of moderate deviations, but violate it outside this part.

entry.title: Reinforced random walk
entry.summary: A survey of reinforced random walk, with emphasis on the linear case.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages. Survey prepared for the 6th ECM, Krakow 2012

entry.title: Besov regularity of stochastic measures
entry.summary: We prove that continuous paths of \sigma-additive in probability set function belong to Besov space.

entry.title: Quantifiers as Adjoint in Probability
entry.summary: Using the Kleisi category of the Giry monad the deterministic existential and universal quantifiers are generalized to incorporate nondeterminism. These probabilistic quantifiers are quantified over the points of the category which are probability measures.

entry.title: A stationary random graph of no growth rate
entry.summary: We present a random isometry-invariant subgraph of a Cayley graph such that with probability 1 its exponential growth rate does not exist.

entry.title: Calculation of Some Expected Values for Parameterized Mean Model with Gaussian Noise
entry.summary: This document derives several expected values related to the parameterized mean model with Gaussian noise and their simplified forms.

entry.title: Small time asymptotics for an example of strictly hypoelliptic heat kernel
entry.summary: A small time asymptotics of the density is established for a simplified (non-Gaussian, strictly hypoelliptic) second chaos process tangent to the Dudley relativistic diffusion.

entry.title: Moments of the location of the maximum of Brownian motion with parabolic drift
entry.summary: We derive integral formulas, involving the Airy function, for moments of the time a two-sided Brownian motion with parabolic drift attains its maximum.

entry.title: Partially Gaussian Stationary Stochastic Processes in Discrete Time
entry.summary: We present here an elementary example, for every fixed positive integer $k,$ of a strictly stationary nongaussian stochastic process in discrete time, all of whose $k$-marginals are gaussian.

entry.title: Continuous random walks and fractional powers of operators
entry.summary: We derive a probabilistic representation for the Fourier symbols of the generators of some stable processes.

entry.title: Hausdorff measure of SLE curves
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that the Hausdorff d-measure of SLE_{\kappa} is zero when d = 1+{\kappa}/ 8 .

entry.title: Degree distribution of an inhomogeneous random intersection graph
entry.summary: We show the asymptotic degree distribution of the typical vertex of a sparse inhomogeneous random intersection graph.

entry.title: Non-random overshoots of Lévy processes
entry.summary: The class of Levy processes for which overshoots are almost surely constant quantities is precisely characterized.

entry.title: Stopping strategies and gambler's ruin problem
entry.summary: We obtain absorption probabilities and expected time until absorption for different stopping strategies in gambler's ruin problem using the concept of multiple function barriers

entry.title: Correlation Inequality for Formal Series
entry.summary: We prove two correlation inequalities .

entry.title: Lyapunov spectrum of a relativistic stochastic flow in the Poincaré group
entry.summary: We determine the Lyapunov spectrum and stable manifolds of some stochastic flows on the Poincar\'e group associated to Dudley's relativistic processes.

entry.title: On Critical Points for Gaussian Vectors with Infinitely Divisible Squares
entry.summary: Investigates the size of the perturbation to the zero mean three dimensional Gaussian vector with infinitely divisible squares so that the infinite divisibility is retained.

entry.title: On the multifractal analysis of the branching random walk in R^d
entry.summary: We establish the almost sure validity of the multifractal formalism for R^d-valued branching random walks on the whole relative interior of the natural convex domain of study.

entry.title: Counting bats
entry.summary: We demonstrate an algorithm that reconstructs the number of walkers in an unknown graph from observations of their returns to a fixed point.

entry.title: Weak error expansion of the implicit Euler scheme
entry.summary: In this paper, we extend the Talay Tubaro theorem to the implicit Euler scheme.

entry.title: Weak error in negative Sobolev spaces for the stochastic heat equation
entry.summary: In this paper, we make another step in the study of weak error of the stochastic heat equation by considering norms as functional.

entry.title: Speed calculations for random walks in degenerate random environments
entry.summary: We calculate explicit speeds for random walks in uniform degenerate random environments. For certain non-uniform random environments, we calculate speeds that are non-monotone.

entry.title: Limit laws for occupation times of stable processes
entry.summary: We prove two limit laws for functionals of one dimensional symmetric 1-stable process using the method of moments, and give a remark on Rosen's paper \cite{Rosen}.

entry.title: Lecture Notes on Random Matrix Theory
entry.summary: Brief lecture notes for a course about random matrices given at the University of Cambridge.

entry.title: Poisson point processes: Large deviation inequalities for the convex distance
entry.summary: An analogue of Talagrand's convex distance for binomial and Poisson point processes is defined. A corresponding large deviation inequality is proved.

entry.title: New Proofs for Several Properties of Capacities
entry.summary: In this note, we find a new way to prove several properties of 2-alternating capacities.

entry.title: Gumbel distribution in exit problems
entry.summary: We explain the connection between the Gumbel limit for diffusion exit times and the theory of extreme values.

entry.title: A Central Limit Theorem for Periodograms Under Rho-Prime Mixing
entry.summary: This paper consists of a proof of a multivariate Central Limit Theorem for "rectangular" sums of dependent complex-valued, rho-prime-mixing random variables indexed by Z^d.

entry.title: A multidimensional version of noise stability
entry.summary: We give a multivariate generalization of Borell's noise stability theorem for Gaussian vectors. As a consequence we recover two inequalities, also due to Borell, for exit times of the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process.

entry.title: On a result of D.W. Stroock
entry.summary: We show how to modify an argument of D. W. Stroock to show that an additive map from one separable Banach space to another, that is "universally Gaussian measurable", must be continuous (hence linear).

entry.title: Some properties of path measures
entry.summary: We call any measure on a path space, a path measure. Some notions about path measures which appear naturally when solving the Schr\"odinger problem are presented and worked out in detail.

entry.title: Local times for multifractional square Gaussian processes
entry.summary: We consider multifractional process given by double Ito--Wiener integrals, which generalize the multifractional Rosenblatt process. We prove that this process is continuous and has a square integrable local time.

entry.title: Trace asymptotics for subordinate semigroups
entry.summary: We address a conjecture of D. Applebaum on small time trace asymptotics for subordinate Brownian motion on compact manifolds.

entry.title: Hydrodynamic limit of quantum random walks
entry.summary: We present a proof of the hydrodynamic limit of independent quantum random walks evolving on Z.

entry.title: A connection of the Brascamp-Lieb inequality with Skorokhod embedding
entry.summary: We reveal a connection of the Brascamp-Lieb inequality with Skorokhod embedding. Error bounds for the inequality in terms of variance are also provided.

entry.title: Concerns with functional depth
entry.summary: We study some problems inherent with certain forms of functional depth, in particular, zero depth and lack of consistency.

entry.title: Alternativity of stable distributions in linear topological spaces, with criterion
entry.summary: We give in this short report a very simple proof of Zero-One Law for the stable distributions in Linear Topological Spaces (LTS).

entry.title: Operator-valued spectral measures and large deviations
entry.summary: We study large deviation properties of random matricial spectral measures.

entry.title: Integral geometry of translation invariant functionals, I: The polytopal case
entry.summary: We study translative integral formulas for certain translation invariant functionals on convex polytopes and discuss local extensions and applications to Poisson processes and Boolean models.

entry.title: Higher moments for random multiplicative measures
entry.summary: We obtain a condition for the $L^q$-convergence of martingales generated by random multiplicative cascade measures for $q>1$ without any self-similarity requirements on the cascades.

entry.title: Random walk on a diagonal lattice with absorbing boundaries
entry.summary: We consider a discrete random walk on a diagonal lattice and obtain explicit solutions of absorption probabilities and probabilities of return in several domains.

entry.title: Two-sided boundary functionals for Kou process
entry.summary: In this paper the moment generating function of two-sided boundary functionals for double exponential jump diffusion processes are treated.

entry.title: Rates of convergence towards the Fréchet distribution
entry.summary: We develop Stein's method for the Fr\'echet distribution and apply it to compute rates of convergence in distribution of renormalized sample maxima to the Fr\'echet distribution.

entry.title: Exponential stability of nonhomogeneous matrix-valued Markovian chains
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize the stability of matrix-valued Markovian chains by periodic data.

entry.title: On the Bellman function of Nazarov, Treil and Volberg
entry.summary: We give an explicit formula for the Bellman function associated with the dual bound related to the unconditional constant of the Haar system.

entry.title: The Theorem of Halmos and Savage under Finite Additivity
entry.summary: Given a generalization of Lebesgue decomposition we obtain an extension to the finitely additive setting of the theorems of Halmos and Savage and of Yan.

entry.title: On (Multi)-Collision Times
entry.summary: A detailed study of the waiting times for the first (multi)-collision in a drawing process.

entry.title: Functions of locally bounded variation on Wiener spaces
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of functions of locally bounded variation on abstract Wiener spaces and study their properties. Some nontrivial examples and applications to stochastic analysis are also discussed.

entry.title: Chernoff's Inequality - A very elementary proof
entry.summary: We give a very simple proof of a strengthened version of Chernoff's Inequality. We derive the same conclusion from much weaker assumptions.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Measures on Infinite Dimensional Spaces
entry.summary: Localization and dilation procedures are discussed for infinite dimensional $\alpha$-concave measures on abstract locally convex spaces (following Borell's hierarchy of hyperbolic measures).

entry.title: Fractional Brownian motion in a nutshell
entry.summary: This is an extended version of the lecture notes to a mini-course devoted to fractional Brownian motion and delivered to the participants of 7th Jagna International Workshop.

entry.title: On Decoupling of Functions of Normal Vectors II
entry.summary: A decoupling type inequality for a sum of functions of Guassian vectors is established.

entry.title: Entropy along W_{1,+}-geodesics on graphs
entry.summary: We study the convexity of the entropy functional along particular interpolating curves defined on the space of finitely supported probability measures on a graph.

entry.title: A Characterization of the Poisson Process revisited
entry.summary: We show that the splitting-characterization of the Poisson point process is an immediate consequence of the Mecke-formula.

entry.title: A Correction Note: Attractive Nearest Neighbor Spin Systems on the Integers
entry.summary: In this note, we discuss a proof in T. Liggett's work on attractive translation invariant nearest neighbor spin systems on the integers. A correction to a wrong estimate is provided.

entry.title: Random walks on discrete Abelian groups
entry.summary: In the present paper we find necessary and sufficient conditions for recurrence of random walks on arbitrary subgroups of the group of rational numbers $\mathbb{Q}$.

entry.title: Introduction to the SK model
entry.summary: This is a review paper for the "Current Developments in Mathematics 2014" conference.

entry.title: A three-series theorem on Lie groups
entry.summary: We obtain a necessary and sufficient condition for the convergence of independent products on Lie groups, as a natural extension of Kolmogorov's three-series theorem. Application to independent random matrices is discussed.

entry.title: On Random Walks in large compact Lie groups
entry.summary: We evaluate the mixing time of certain random walks on large unitary groups

entry.title: Crushing candies on the line
entry.summary: We investigate stability properties of a probabilistic cellular automaton based on the candy crush game.

entry.title: Erratum: Limit theorems for Betti numbers of random simplicial complexes
entry.summary: We correct the proofs of the main theorems in our paper "Limit theorems for Betti numbers of random simplicial complexes".

entry.title: Loop measures without transition probabilities
entry.summary: We construct Markov loop measures without assuming the existence of densities for transition probabilities.

entry.title: On the integral representation of g-expectations with terminal constraints
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the integral representation of g-expectations with two kinds of terminal constraints, and obtain the corresponding necessary and sufficient conditions.

entry.title: A Randomized Version of the Collatz $3x + 1$ Problem
entry.summary: We propose a stochastic version of the Collatz $3x + 1$ Problem.

entry.title: The projection spectral theorem and Jacobi fields
entry.summary: We review several applications of Berezansky's projection spectral theorem to Jacobi fields in a symmetric Fock space, which lead to L\'evy white noise measures.

entry.title: Calculo Estocastico, EDEs y EDPs
entry.summary: This manuscript is a self-contained overview of essential results of stochastic calculus and stochastic differential equations, and their connection with final-value problems for second order linear PDEs.

entry.title: On the Generalized Arcsine Probability Distribution with Bounded Support
entry.summary: Properties of the beta functions are investigated. We define the generalized arcsine probability distribution with bounded support. The properties of the beta functions prove some results for this distribution.

entry.title: Group-Walk Random Graphs
entry.summary: We introduce a construction that gives rise to a variety of "geometric" finite random graphs, and describe connections to the Poisson boundary, Naim's kernel, and Sznitman's random interlacements.

entry.title: Activated Random Walks
entry.summary: Lecture Notes. Minicourse given at the workshop "Activated Random Walks, DLA, and related topics" at IM\'eRA-Marseille, March 2015.

entry.title: Empirical Processes and Schatte Model
entry.summary: We proved the strong approximation result for the empirical process derived from its corresponding Schatte model. The corresponding strong approximation rate obtained is 1/16.

entry.title: On Mixing Properties of Some INAR Models
entry.summary: Strictly stationary INAR(1) ("integer-valued autoregressive processes of order 1") with Poisson innovations are "interlaced rho-mixing".

entry.title: Hölderian weak invariance principle under Maxwell and Woodroofe condition
entry.summary: We investigate the weak invariance principle in H\"older spaces under some reinforcement of the Maxwell and Woodroofe condition.

entry.title: Vector rearrangement invariant banach spaces of random variables with exponential decreasing tails of distributions
entry.summary: We present in this paper the theory of multivariate Banach spaces of random variables with exponential decreasing tails of distributions.

entry.title: Percolation and coarse conformal uniformization
entry.summary: We formulate conjectures regarding percolation on planar triangulations suggested by assuming (quasi) invariance under coarse conformal uniformization.

entry.title: Percolation and Random Walks
entry.summary: The fourfold research proposal regards in particular: critical oriented percolation; random walk limit laws; neural networks with long-range connections; the ant in a labyrinth.

entry.title: The Value Functions of Markov Decision Processes
entry.summary: We provide a full characterization of the set of value functions of Markov decision processes.

entry.title: Problem optymalizacyjny de Finettiego dla procesów Lévy'ego
entry.summary: We give a review of the state of the art with regard to the dividend problem.

entry.title: Compact support property of SuperBrownian Motion in random environments
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove the compact support property for a class of nonlinear SPDE including the equation that the density of one-dimensional Super-Brownian Motion in random environment satisfies.

entry.title: Operads in It{ô} calculus
entry.summary: We discuss algebraic and geometric properties of the It{\^o} calculus

entry.title: An interpolation proof of Ehrhard's inequality
entry.summary: We prove Ehrhard's inequality using interpolation along the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck semi-group. We also provide an improved Jensen inequality for Gaussian variables that might be of independent interest.

entry.title: Extremal particles in branching processess
entry.summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate two related spatial branching models with the unbounded branching intensity. The objective is to describe the asymptotic behaviour of the extremal particle.

entry.title: A remark on the convergence of Betti numbers in the thermodynamic regime
entry.summary: The convergence of the expectations of Betti numbers of \v{C}ech complexes built on binomial point processes in the thermodynamic regime is established.

entry.title: Strong times and first hitting
entry.summary: We generalize the notion of strong stationary time and we give a representation formula for the hitting time to a target set in the general case of non-reversible Markov processes.

entry.title: Distributional Tail Estimation Through Its Characteristic Function
entry.summary: There is given a method for estimation of a probability distribution tail in terms of characteristic function. Key words: characteristic function; tail of a distribution.

entry.title: Directed polymer in random environment and two points state space
entry.summary: We give an exact expression for the partition function of a continuous time DPRE on a two points state space.

entry.title: A criteria of strong H-differentiability
entry.summary: We give a criteria for a Malliavin differentiable function to be strongly H-differentiable.

entry.title: Continuity of Random Fields on Riemannian Manifolds
entry.summary: A theorem of the Kolmogorov--Chentsov type is proved for random fields on a Riemannian manifold.

entry.title: On the Semi-Classical Brownian Bridge Measure
entry.summary: We prove an integration by parts formula for the probability measure induced by the semi-classical Riemmanian Brownian bridge over a manifold with a pole.

entry.title: A representation for the Kantorovich--Rubinstein distance on the abstract Wiener space
entry.summary: A representation for the Kantorovich--Rubinstein distance between probability measures on an abstract Wiener space in terms of the extended stochastic integral (or, divergence) operator is obtained.

entry.title: Optimal blow up rate for the constants of Khinchin type inequalities
entry.summary: We provide, among other results, the optimal blow up rate of the constants of a family of Khinchin inequalities for multiple sums.

entry.title: Reconstruction of colourings without freezing
entry.summary: We prove that reconstruction in the $k$-colouring model occurs strictly below the threshold for freezing for large $k$.

entry.title: On strict convergence of stochastic gradients
entry.summary: We discuss conditions ensuring the (strict) convergence of stochastic gradient algorithms.

entry.title: Perturbations of continuous-time Markov chains
entry.summary: The equivalence of regularity of a Q-matrix with its bounded perturbations is proved and a integration by parts formula is established for the associated Feller minimal transition functions.

entry.title: Hitting Time and Convergence Rate Bounds for Symmetric Langevin Diffusions
entry.summary: We provide quantitative bounds on the convergence to stationarity of real-valued Langevin diffusions with symmetric target densities.

entry.title: An electric-resistance approach to return time
entry.summary: A new proof is given for the formula for the expected return time of a random walk on a graph. This proof makes use of known relationships between electric resistance and random walks.

entry.title: An approach theoretic version of Anscombe's theorem
entry.summary: We establish an approach theoretic version of Anscombe's theorem, which enhances its applicational power.

entry.title: Piecewise constant local martingales with bounded numbers of jumps
entry.summary: A piecewise constant local martingale $M$ with boundedly many jumps is a uniformly integrable martingale if and only if $M_\infty^-$ is integrable.

entry.title: Non trivial limit distributions for transient renewal chains
entry.summary: In this work we study the asymptotic of renewal sequences associated with certain transient renewal Markov chains and enquire about the existence of limit laws in this set up.

entry.title: Infinite-dimensional Stochastic Differential Equations with Symmetry
entry.summary: We review recent progress in the study of infinite-dimensional stochastic differential equations with symmetry. This paper contains examples arising from random matrix theory.

entry.title: An introduction to singular SPDEs
entry.summary: We review recent results on the analysis of singular stochastic partial differential equations in the language of paracontrolled distributions.

entry.title: A generalization of Tanaka's formula
entry.summary: We prove some new results related to Tanaka's formula.

entry.title: On the asymptotic behavior of Bessel-like diffusions
entry.summary: We derive the asymptotic behavior of the transition probability density of the Bessel-like diffusions for "dimension" $\rho = 0$.

entry.title: $p_c$, $p_u$ and graph limits
entry.summary: A question relating the critical probability for percolation, the critical probability for a unique infinite cluster and graph limits is presented, together with some partial results.

entry.title: Hilbert-valued self-intersection local times for planar Brownian motion
entry.summary: In the paper Dynkin construction for self-intersection local time of planar Wiener process is extended on Hilbert-valued weights.

entry.title: How many paths to simulate correlated Brownian motions?
entry.summary: We provide an explicit formula giving the optimal number of paths needed to simulate two correlated Brownian motions.

entry.title: Recurrence region of multiuser Aloha
entry.summary: In this paper, we provide upper and lower bounds for the region of positive recurrence for a general finite user Aloha network.

entry.title: Tail bounds for sums of geometric and exponential variables
entry.summary: We give explicit bounds for the tail probabilities for sums of independent geometric or exponential variables, possibly with different parameters.

entry.title: On some geometrical methods leading to martingales useful in measure theory
entry.summary: In this paper I show a geometrical method to obtain construction of the Nikodym type set.

entry.title: Precise large deviations for random walk in random environment
entry.summary: We study one-dimensional nearest neighbour random walk in site-random environment. We establish precise (sharp) large deviations in the so-called ballistic regime.

entry.title: Girsanov's transformation for SLE(kappa,rho) processes, intersection exponents and hiding exponents
entry.summary: We relate the formulas giving Brownian (and other) intersection exponents to the absolute continuity relations between Bessel process of different dimensions, via the two-parameter family of Schramm-Loewner Evolution processes SLE(kappa,rho) introduced in arXiv:math.PR/0209343. This allows also to compute the value of some new exponents (``hiding exponents'') related to SLEs and planar Brownian motions.

entry.title: Connecting Yule Process, Bisection and Binary Search Tree via Martingales
entry.summary: We present new links between some remarkable martingales found in the study of the Binary Search Tree, or of the Bisection Problem, looking at them on the probability space of a continuous time binary branching process.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of the Iranian Statistical Society Vol.3 (2) pp. 89-116 (2004)

entry.title: Corrections and acknowledgment for ``Local limit theory and large deviations for supercritical branching processes''
entry.summary: Corrections and acknowledgment for ``Local limit theory and large deviations for supercritical branching processes'' [math.PR/0407059]
entry.arxiv:comment: Published at http://dx.doi.org/10.1214/105051606000000574 in the Annals of Applied Probability (http://www.imstat.org/aap/) by the Institute of Mathematical Statistics (http://www.imstat.org)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Annals of Applied Probability 2006, Vol. 16, No. 4, 2272-2272

entry.title: Correction. Error estimates for binomial approximations of game options
entry.summary: Correction for Error estimates for binomial approximations of game options [math.PR/0607123]
entry.arxiv:comment: Published at http://dx.doi.org/10.1214/105051606000000808 in the Annals of Applied Probability (http://www.imstat.org/aap/) by the Institute of Mathematical Statistics (http://www.imstat.org)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Annals of Applied Probability 2006, Vol. 16, No. 4, 2273-2275

entry.title: Note on the Heat-Kernel Decay for Random Walk among Random Conductances with Heavy Tail
entry.summary: Results have been moved to a published article, see arXiv:0812.2669v4[math.PR]
entry.arxiv:comment: The results of this note constitute now a section in the article with the journal reference given below

entry.title: Joint convergence along different subsequences of the signed cubic variation of fractional Brownian motion II
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to provide a complete description the convergence in distribution of two subsequences of the signed cubic variation of the fractional Brownian motion with Hurst parameter $H = 1/6$.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is a sequel to arXiv:1210.1560 [math.PR]

entry.title: Higher Dimensional Quasi-Power Theorem and Berry-Esseen Inequality
entry.summary: Hwang's quasi-power theorem asserts that a sequence of random variables whose moment generating functions are approximately given by powers of some analytic function is asymptotically normally distributed. This theorem is generalised to higher dimensional random variables. To obtain this result, a higher dimensional analogue of the Berry-Esseen inequality is proved, generalising a two-dimensional version by Sadikova.
entry.arxiv:comment: Full version of the extended abstract arXiv:1602.04055 [math.PR]

entry.title: Sets avoided by Brownian motion
entry.summary: Any fixed cylinder is hit almost surely by a 3-dimensional Brownian motion, but is there a random cylinder that is in the complement? We answer this for cylinders, and then replacing a cylinder with a more general set.

entry.title: First passage percolation and a model for competing spatial growth
entry.summary: We generalize Richardson's model by starting with two sites of different colors and giving each new site the color of the site that spawned it. We show that co-existence is possible.

entry.title: The probability that Brownian motion almost covers a line
entry.summary: Lower and upper estimates are given for the probability that the epsilon-enlargement of planar Brownian motion to time 1 (the epsilon sausage) contains a unit line segment. The estimates imply that Brownian motion to time 1 itself contains no line segment.

entry.title: Completely regular multivariate stationary process and the Muckenhoupt condition
entry.summary: We give necessary and sufficient conditions for a multivariate stationary stochastic process to be completely regular. We also give the answer to a question of V.V. Peller concerning the spectral measure characterization of such processes.

entry.title: A Simple Path to Biggins' Martingale Convergence for Branching Random Walk
entry.summary: We give a simple non-analytic proof of Biggins' theorem on martingale convergence for branching random walks.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Classical and Modern Branching Processes, K. Athreya and P. Jagers (editors), Springer, New York, 1997, pp. 217--222

entry.title: Brownian Sheet Images and Bessel-Riesz Capacity
entry.summary: We show that the image of a 2-dimensional set under d-dimensional, 2-parameter Brownian sheet can have positive Lebesgue measure, if and only if the set in question has positive (d/2)-dimensional Bessel-Riesz capacity. Our methods solve a problem of J.-P. Kahane.

entry.title: Equilibrium condition in Insurance Pricing: a particular case
entry.summary: Equilibrium pricing has been proven to underlie the rational Insured expectancy of premia additivity for composition of policies fully covering independent risks.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages; PDF and PS; typos corrected

entry.title: Some function spaces related to the Brownian motion on simple nested fractals
entry.summary: In this paper we identify the domain of the Dirichlet form associated with the Brownian motion on simple nested fractals with an integral Lipschitz space. This result generalizes such an identification on the Sierpi\'nski gasket, carried on by Jonsson.

entry.title: Scaling limit of Fourier-Walsh coefficients (a framework)
entry.summary: Independent random signs can govern various discrete models that converge to non-isomorphic continuous limits. Convergence of Fourier-Walsh spectra is established under appropriate conditions.

entry.title: Monotonicity property for a class of semilinear partial differential equations
entry.summary: We establish a monotonicity property in the space variable for the solutions of an initial boundary value problem concerned with the parabolic partial differential equation connected with super-Brownian motion.

entry.title: Fractional Brownian Motion Limit for a Model of Turbulent Transport
entry.summary: Passive scalar motion in a family of random Gaussian velocity fields with long-range correlations is shown to converge to persistent fractional Brownian motions in long times.

entry.title: Noise sensitivity on continuous products: an answer to an old question of J. Feldman
entry.summary: A relation between sigma-additivity and linearizability, conjectured by Jacob Feldman in 1971 for continuous products of probability spaces, is established by relating both notions to a recent idea of noise stability/sensitivity.

entry.title: Limit Theorems for Motions in a Flow with a Nonzero Drift
entry.summary: We establish diffusion and fractional Brownian motion approximations for motions in a Markovian Gaussian random field with a nonzero mean.

author.name: Albert Fannjiang
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, University of California, Davis

author.name: Tomasz Komorowski
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Mathemathics, Maria Curie-Skłodowska University, Lublin

entry.title: Discrete Growth Models
entry.summary: Part I of the thesis gives a complete analysis of gaps in a one-dimensional creation-annihilation model. Part II contains a proof of the existence of infinitely many holes in the two-dimensional DLA cluster.

entry.title: Central Limit Theorem for local linear statistics in classical compact groups and related combinatorial identities
entry.summary: We discuss CLT for the global and local linear statistics of random matrices from classical compact groups. The main part of our proofs are certain combinatorial identities much in the spirit of works by Kac and Spohn.

entry.title: Singularity of Some Random Continued Fractions
entry.summary: We prove singularity of some distributions of random continued fractions that correspond to iterated function systems with overlap and a parabolic point. These arose while studying the conductance of Galton-Watson trees.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in J. Theoret. Prob

entry.title: Coalescence of skew Brownian motions
entry.summary: We prove that two skew Brownian motions with the same skewness parameter (different from 0) and driven by the same Brownian motion coalesce a.s.

entry.title: Random Walks and Electric Networks
entry.summary: A popular account of the connection between random walks and electric networks.
entry.arxiv:comment: First published in 1984 by the Mathematical Association of America; now freely redistributable under the terms of the GNU General Public License

entry.title: No more than three favourite sites for simple random walk
entry.summary: We prove that, with probability one, eventually there are no more than three favourite (i.e. most visited) sites of simple random walk. This partially answers a relatively long standing question of Pal Erdos and Pal Revesz.

entry.title: Favourite sites of simple random walk
entry.summary: We survey the current status of the list of questions related to the favourite (or: most visited) sites of simple random walk on Z, raised by Pal Erdos and Pal Revesz in the early eighties.

entry.title: On the probabilistic rationale of I-divergence and J-divergence minimization
entry.summary: A probabilistic rationale for I-divergence minimization (relative entropy maximization), non-parametric likelihood maximization and J-divergence minimization (Jeffres' entropy maximization) criteria is provided.

entry.title: Stationary random fields with linear regressions
entry.summary: We analyze certain stationary fields with linear regressions and quadratic conditional variances. This classic probabilistic problem leads somewhat unexpectedly to stationary Markov processes closely tied to non-commutative probability through the q-Hermite polynomials.

entry.title: Variational representations of Varadhan Functionals
entry.summary: Motivated by the theory of large deviations, we introduce a class of non-negative non-linear functionals that have a variational "rate function" representation.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of AMS Vol 129 Number 7 Pages 2119-2125

entry.title: Some Comparisons for Gaussian Processes
entry.summary: Extensions and variants are given for the well-known comparison principle for Gaussian processes based on ordering by pairwise distance.

entry.title: On first exit times for homogeneous diffusion processes
entry.summary: It is given an effective upper estimate of expectation of |T_1-T_2|, where T_1 and T_2 are the first exit times from a region for two vector diffusion processes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theory of Probability and Its Application, 1987, v.31, No 3, pp.497-498

entry.title: Some Ergodic Theorems for Random Rotations on Wiener Space
entry.summary: In this paper we study ergodicity and mixing property of some measure preserving transformations on the Wiener space (W,H,\mu) which are generated by some random unitary operators defined on the Cameron-Martin space H.

entry.title: A conditional Entropy Power Inequality for dependent variables
entry.summary: We provide a condition under which a version of Shannon's Entropy Power Inequality will hold for dependent variables. We provide information inequalities extending those found in the independent case.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, Vol 50/8, 2004, p. 1581-1583

entry.title: Existence And Uniqueness Of Stationary Solution Of Nonlinear Stochastic Differential Equation With Memory
entry.summary: A stochastic differential equation with infinite memory is considered. The drift coefficient of the equation is a nonlinear functional of the past history of the solution. Sufficient conditions for existence and uniqueness of stationary solution are given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, submitted to Probability Theory and Applications

entry.title: A self-avoiding walk with attractive interactions
entry.summary: A self-avoiding walk with small attractive interactions is described here. The existence of the connective constant is established, and the diffusive behavior is proved using the method of the lace expansion.

entry.title: Linear stochastic differential equations with functional boundary conditions
entry.summary: We consider linear n-th order stochastic differential equations on [0,1], with linear boundary conditions supported by a finite subset of [0,1]. We study some features of the solution to these problems, and especially its conditional independence properties of Markovian type.

entry.title: Random matrices, non-colliding processes and queues
entry.summary: This is survey of some recent results connecting random matrices, non-colliding processes and queues.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Seminaire de Probabilites XXXVI
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Seminaire de Probabilites XXXVI, 165--182. Lecture Notes in Mathematics 1801, Springer, 2003.

entry.title: Gibbs measures and semiclassical approximations to action minimizing measures
entry.summary: We study the approximation of action minimizing measures, for a mechanical Lagrangian on the torus, by the probability densities given by quasi-periodic eigenfunctions of the Schrodinger operator.

entry.title: On exponential stability of Wonham filter
entry.summary: We give elementary proof of a stability result concerning an exponential asymptotic ($t\to\infty$) for filtering estimates generated by wrongly initialized Wonham filter. This proof is based on new exponential bound having independent interest.

entry.title: On diffusion approximation with discontinuous coefficients
entry.summary: Convergence of stochastic processes with jumps to diffusion processes is investigated in the case when the limit process has discontinuous coefficients. An example is given in which the diffusion approximation of a queueing model yields a diffusion process with discontinuous diffusion and drift coefficients.

entry.title: A note on edge oriented reinforced random walks and RWRE
entry.summary: This work introduces the notion of edge oriented reinforced random walk which proposes in a general framework an alternative understanding of the annealed law of random walks in random environment.

entry.title: Good Local Bounds for Simple Random Walks
entry.summary: We give a local central limit theorem for simple random walks on Z^d, including Gaussian error estimates. The detailed proof combines standard large deviation techniques with Cramer-Edgeworth expansions for lattice distributions.

entry.title: Limit Theorem for Sums of Random Products
entry.summary: We study a generalization of the Random Energy Model to the case when the number of exponential factors varies at random. Also a relation between REM and the Erd"os-R'enyi limit theorem for maximums of partial sums is considered.

entry.title: Three Sampling Formulas
entry.summary: Sampling formulas describe probability laws of exchangeable combinatorial structures like partitions and compositions. We give a brief account of two known parametric families of sampling formulas and add a new family to the list.

entry.title: An asymptotic expansion for the discrete harmonic potential
entry.summary: We give two algorithms that allow to get arbitrary precision asymptotics for the harmonic potential of a random walk.

entry.title: A Resistance Bound via an Isoperimetric Inequality
entry.summary: An isoperimetric upper bound on the resistance is given. As a corollary we resolve two problems, regarding mean commute time on finite graphs and resistance on percolation clusters. Further conjectures are presented.

entry.title: Some highlights of percolation
entry.summary: We describe the percolation model and some of the principal results and open problems in percolation theory. We also discuss briefly the spectacular recent progress by Lawler, Schramm, Smirnov and Werner towards understanding the phase transition of percolation (on the triangular lattice).
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 1, 345--362

entry.title: Normed convergence property for hypergroups admitting an invariant measure
entry.summary: We prove that a hypergroup admitting a countable basis and an invariant Haar measure has normed convergence property if and only if it is compact.

entry.title: Couplings of Uniform Spanniing Forests
entry.summary: We prove the existence of an automorphism-invariant coupling for the wired and the free uniform spanning forests on Cayley graphs of finitely generated residually amenable groups.

entry.title: On $L_1$-distance between first exit times from two regions
entry.summary: First exit times from regions and their dependence on variations of boundaries are discussed for diffusion processes. The paper presents an estimate of $L_1$-distance between exit times from two regions via expectations of exit times.

entry.title: On the p-Logarithmic and Alpha-Power Divergence Measures in Information Theory
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce the concepts of p-logarithmic and Alpha-power divergence measures and point out a number of basic results.

entry.title: Some aspects of additive coalescents
entry.summary: We present some aspects of the so-called additive coalescence, with a focus on its connections with random trees, Brownian excursion, certain bridges with exchangeable increments, L\'evy processes, and sticky particle systems.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 15--24

entry.title: Vitesse dans le theoreme limite central pour certains processus stationnaires fortement decorreles
entry.summary: We prove a central limit theorem with speed $n^{-1/2}$ for stationary processes satisfying a strong decorrelation hypothesis. The proof is a modification of the proof of a theorem of Rio. It is elementary but quite long and technical.

entry.title: On Spectra of Noises associated with Harris flows
entry.summary: We study the noise, in the sense of Tsirelson, generated by Harris flows. A criterion is given for the noise to be non-white, and in this case we study the associated spectral sets.

entry.title: Random probability measures via Polya sequences: revisiting the Blackwell-MacQueen urn scheme
entry.summary: Sufficient conditions are developed for a class of generalized Polya urn schemes ensuring exchangeability. The extended class includes the Blackwell-MacQueen Polya urn and the urn schemes for the two-parameter Poisson-Dirichlet process and finite dimensional Dirichlet priors among others.

entry.title: Excited random walk in three dimensions has positive speed
entry.summary: Excited random walk is a random walk that has a positive drift to the right when it reaches a vertex it hasn't been to before. We show that in three dimensions the walk drifts to the right in non-zero speed.

entry.title: Limiting distribution of last passage percolation models
entry.summary: We survey some results and applications of last percolation models of which the limiting distribution can be evaluated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, a survey paper. A new reference is included at p.5

entry.title: Stochastic differential equations with non-lipschitz coefficients: I. Pathwise uniqueness and large deviation
entry.summary: We study a class of stochastic differential equations with non-Lipschitzian coefficients.A unique strong solution is obtained and a large deviation principle of Freidln-Wentzell type has been established.
entry.arxiv:comment: A short version will be published in C. R. Acad. Paris

entry.title: Quicksort with unreliable comparisons: a probabilistic analysis
entry.summary: We provide a probabilistic analysis of the output of Quicksort when comparisons can err.

entry.title: Maximal local time of a d-dimensional simple random walk on subsets
entry.summary: Strong theorems are given for the maximal local time on balls and subspaces for the $d$-dimensional simple symmetric random walk.

entry.title: A General Divergence Measure for Monotonic Functions and Applications in Information Theory
entry.summary: A general divergence measure for monotonic functions is introduced. Its connections with the f-divergence for convex functions are explored. The main properties are pointed out.

entry.title: The square of white noise as a Jacobi field
entry.summary: We identify the representation of the square of white noise obtained by L. Accardi, U. Franz and M. Skeide in [Comm. Math. Phys. 228 (2002), 123--150] with the Jacobi field of a L\'evy process of Meixner's type.

entry.title: Universality In Sherrington-Kirkpatrick's Spin Glass Model
entry.summary: We show that the limiting free energy in Sherrington-Kirkpatrick's Spin Glass Model does not depend on the environment.

entry.title: Maximum Variation of Total Risk
entry.summary: Let Z>0 be a random time. The total risk of discovering Z in the next time interval (t,t+dt) is never more variable than an exponential of mean one, which is achieved when the information up to time t is sigma(Z wedge t).

entry.title: Tree-indexed processes
entry.summary: This article examines a recent body of work on stochastic processes indexed by a tree. Emphasis is on the application of this new framework to existing probability models. Proofs are largely omitted, with references provided.

entry.title: A martingale proof of Dobrushin's theorem for non-homogeneous Markov chains
entry.summary: In 1956, Dobrushin proved a definitive central limit theorem for non-homogeneous Markov chains. In this note, a shorter and different proof elucidating more the assumptions is given through martingale approximation.

entry.title: The Critical Value of the Contact Process with Added and Removed Edges
entry.summary: We show that the critical value for the contact process on a vertex-transitive graph G with finitely many edges added and/or removed is the same as the critical value for the contact process on G.

entry.title: Convergence of values in optimal stopping
entry.summary: Under the hypothesis of convergence in probability of a sequence of c\`adl\`ag processes $(X^n)_n$ to a c\`adl\`ag process $X$, we are interested in the convergence of corresponding values in optimal stopping. We give results under hypothesis of inclusion of filtrations or convergence of filtrations.

entry.title: Random walks with $k$-wise independent increments
entry.summary: We construct examples of a random walk with pairwise-independent steps which is almost-surely bounded, and for any $m$ and $k$ a random walk with $k$-wise independent steps which has no stationary distribution modulo $m$.

entry.title: Harnesses, Levy bridges and Monsieur Jourdain
entry.summary: Relations between so-called harness processes and initial enlargements of the filtration of a Levy process with its positions at fixed times are investigated.

entry.title: On maximum likelihood estimation of the extreme value index
entry.summary: We prove asymptotic normality of the so-called maximum likelihood estimator of the extreme value index.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Annals of Applied Probability 2004, Vol. 14, No. 3, 1179-1201

entry.title: Asymptotic Behavior of Random Heaps
entry.summary: We study the asymptotic behavior of a random walk on the locally free group, and disprove a conjecture concerning the expected number of removeable generators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 3 figures. To appear: Random Structures and Algorithms

entry.title: An extension which is relatively twofold mixing but not threefold mixing
entry.summary: We give an example of a dynamical system which is mixing relative to one of its factors, but for which relative mixing of order three does not hold.

entry.title: A log-scale limit theorem for one-dimensional random walks in random environments
entry.summary: We consider a random walk X_n in non-i.i.d. environment and show that the ratio of log X_n to log n converges in probability to a positive constant.

entry.title: On the Symmetry of the Diffusion Coefficient in Asymmetric Simple Exclusion
entry.summary: We prove the symmetry of the Diffusion Coefficient appearing in the fluctuation-dissipation theorem for the general asymmetric simple exclusion process.

entry.title: A multivariate generalization of Hoeffding's inequality
entry.summary: We prove a multivariate version of Hoeffding's inequality about the distribution of homogeneous polynomials of Rademacher functions. The proof is based on such an estimate about the moments of homogeneous polynomials of Rademacher functions which can be considered as an improvement of Borell's inequality in a most important special case.

entry.title: An Extreme-Value Analysis of the LIL for Brownian Motion
entry.summary: We present an extreme-value analysis of the classical law of the iterated logarithm (LIL) for Brownian motion. Our result can be viewed as a new improvement to the LIL.

entry.title: Exact Constants in the Rosenthal Moment Inequalities for Sums of independent centered Random Variables
entry.summary: We study the exact constants in the moment inequalities for sums of centered independent random variables: improve their asymptotics, low and upper bounds, calculate more exact asymptotics, elaborate the numerical algorithm for their calculation, study the class of smoothing etc.

entry.title: An Urn Model of Diaconis
entry.summary: An urn model of Diaconis and some generalizations are discussed. A convergence theorem is proved that implies for Diaconis' model that the empirical distribution of balls in the urn converges with probability one to the uniform distribution.

entry.title: Almost sure estimates for the concentration neighborhood of Sinai's walk
entry.summary: We consider Sinai's random walk in random environment. We prove that infinitely often (i.o.) the size of the concentration neighborhood of this random walk is almost surely bounded. As an application we get that i.o. the maximal distance between two favorite sites is almost surely bounded.

entry.title: The maximum entropy state
entry.summary: We give an algorithm for calculating the maximum entropy state as the least fixed point of a Scott continuous mapping on the domain of classical states in their Bayesian order.

entry.title: Different Aspects of a Model for Random Fragmentation Processes
entry.summary: This text surveys different probabilistic aspects of a model which is used to describe the evolution of an object that falls apart randomly as time passes. Each point of view yields useful techniques to establish properties of such random fragmentation processes.

entry.title: Invariance principles for standard-normalized and self-normalized random fields
entry.summary: We investigate the invariance principle for set-indexed partial sums of a stationary field $(X\_{k})\_{k\in\mathbb{Z}^{d}}$ of martingale-difference or independent random variables under standard-normalization or self-normalization respectively.

entry.title: A two armed bandit type problem revisited
entry.summary: In a recent paper, M. Bena\"{i}m and G. Ben Arous solve a multi-armed bandit problem arising in the theory of learning in games. We propose an short elementary proof of this result based on a variant of the Kronecker Lemma.

entry.title: Individual displacements in hashing with coalesced chains
entry.summary: We study the asymptotic distribution of the displacements in hashing with coalesced chains, for both late-insertion and early-insertion. Asymptotic formulas for means and variances follow. The method uses Poissonization and some stochastic calculus.

entry.title: On tail distributions of supremum and quadratic variation of local martingales
entry.summary: We extend some known results relating the distribution tails of a continuous local martingale supremum and its quadratic variation to the case of locally square integrable martingales with bounded jumps. The predictable and optional quadratic variations are involved in the main result.

entry.title: Random walks in a random environment
entry.summary: Random walks as well as diffusions in random media are considered. Methods are developed that allow one to establish large deviation results for both the `quenched' and the `averaged' case.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Indian Acad. Sci. (Math. Sci.), Vol. 114, No. 4, November 2004, pp. 309-318

entry.title: A random walk proof of the Erdos-Taylor conjecture
entry.summary: For the simple random walk in Z^2 we study those points which are visited an unusually large number of times, and provide a new proof of the Erdos-Taylor conjecture describing the number of visits to the most visited point.

entry.title: Boundary Harnack Principle for fractional powers of Laplacian on the Sierpinski carpet
