entry.summary: We prove the Boundary Harnack Principle related to fractional powers of Laplacian for some natural regions in the two-dimensional Sierpinski carpet. This is a natual application of a probabilistic method based on the Ikeda-Watanabe formula

entry.title: Generalization of the Critical Volume NTCP Model in the Radiobiology
entry.summary: A generalization of the well known critical volume NTCP model is proposed to take into account dependence of the functional subunits of irradiated organ (or tissue). A new statistical version of the CLT is established to analyze the corresponding random fields.

entry.title: Heavy points of a d-dimensional simple random walk
entry.summary: For a simple symmetric random walk in dimension $d\geq 3$, a uniform strong law of large numbers is proved for the number of sites with given local time up to time $n$.

entry.title: Coding map for a contractive Markov system
entry.summary: In this paper, we develop the theory of contractive Markov systems initiated in \cite{Wer1}. We construct a coding map for such systems and investigate some of its properties.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Mathematical Proceedings of the Cambridge Philosophical Society (2006), 140: 333-347 Cambridge University Press

entry.title: Poisson Statistics for the Largest Eigenvalues in Random Matrix Ensemble
entry.summary: The paper studies the spectral properties of large Wigner, band and sample covariance random matrices with heavy tails of the marginal distributions of matrix entries.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is an extended version of my talk at the QMath 9 conference at Giens, France on September 13-17, 2004

entry.title: Gaussian estimates for symmetric simple exclusion processes
entry.summary: We prove Gaussian tail estimates for the transition probability of $n$ particles evolving as symmetric exclusion processes on $\bb Z^d$, improving results obtained in \cite{l}. We derive from this result a non-equilibrium Boltzmann-Gibbs principle for the symmetric simple exclusion process in dimension 1 starting from a product measure with slowly varying parameter.

entry.title: Nonequilibrium Central Limit Theorem for a Tagged Particle in Symmetric Simple Exclusion
entry.summary: We prove a nonequilibirum central limit theorem for the position of a tagged particle in the one-dimensional nearest-neighbor symmetric simple exclusion process under diffusive scaling starting from a Bernoulli product measure associated to a smooth profile $\rho_0:\bb R\to [0,1]$.

entry.title: On random measures on the space of trajectories and strong and weak solutions of stochastic equations
entry.summary: The random measures on the space of continuous functions are considered. Stationary random measures are described. The weak solutions of the stochastic equations are substituted by the strong measure-valued solutions.

entry.title: Percolation, boundary, noise: an experiment
entry.summary: The scaling limit of the critical percolation, is it a black noise? The answer depends on stability to perturbations concentrated along a line. This text, containing no proofs, reports experimental results that suggest the affirmative answer.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. The file is large because of figures

entry.title: Statistics of Extreme Spacings in Determinantal Random Point Processes
entry.summary: We study translation-invariant determinantal random point fields on the real line. We prove, under quite general conditions, that the smallest nearest spacings between the particles in a large interval have Poisson statistics as the length of the interval goes to infinity.

entry.title: Percolation theory
entry.summary: This is a survey article to be part of the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, to be published by Elsevier in the beginning of 2006.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics (Elsevier, 2006)

entry.title: Estimates of potential kernel and Harnack's inequality for anisotropic fractional Laplacian
entry.summary: We characterize those homogeneous translation invariant symmetric non-local operators with positive maximum principle whose harmonic functions satisfy Harnack's inequality. We also estimate the corresponding semigroup and the potential kernel.

entry.title: A simple invariance theorem
entry.summary: We present a simple extension of Lindeberg's argument for the Central Limit Theorem to get a general invariance result. We apply the technique to prove results from random matrix theory, spin glasses, and maxima of random fields.

entry.title: Brownian local minima and other random dense countable sets
entry.summary: We compare two examples of random dense countable sets, `Brownian local minima' and `unordered uniform infinite sample'. They appear to be identically distributed. A framework for such notions is proposed. In addition, random elements of other singular spaces (especially, reals modulo rationals) are considered.

entry.title: Dyson's Brownian motions, intertwining and interlacing
entry.summary: A family of reflected Brownian motions is used to construct Dyson's process of non-colliding Brownian motions. A number of explicit formulae are given, including one for the distribution of a family of coalescing Brownian motions.

entry.title: Counting the Chain Records: The Product Case
entry.summary: Chain records is a new type of multidimensional record. We discuss how often the chain records are broken when the background sampling is from the unit cube with uniform distribution (or, more generally, from an arbitrary continuous product distribution).

entry.title: On invariance of domains with smooth boundaries with respect to stochastic differential equations
entry.summary: We prove constructible sufficient conditions of lack of exit by solutions of stochastic differential Ito's equations from domains with smooth boundaries

entry.title: Hypercontractivity for perturbed diffusion semigroups
entry.summary: $\mu$ being a nonnegative measure satisfying some log-Sobolev inequality, we give conditions on F for the measure $\nu=e^{-2F} \mu$ to also satisfy some log-Sobolev inequality. Explicit examples are studied.

entry.title: Pathwise uniqueness for two dimensional reflecting Brownian motion in Lipschitz domains
entry.summary: We give a simple proof that in a Lipschitz domain in two dimensions with Lipschitz constant one, there is pathwise uniqueness for the Skorokhod equation governing reflecting Brownian motion.

entry.title: Slices of Brownian Sheet: New Results, and Open Problems
entry.summary: We can view Brownian sheet as a sequence of interacting Brownian motions or slices. Here we present a number of results about the slices of the sheet. A common feature of our results is that they exhibit phase transition. In addition, a number of open problems are presented.

entry.title: Winning rate in the full-information best choice problem
entry.summary: Following a long-standing suggestion by Gilbert and Mosteller, we derive an explicit formula for the asymptotic winning rate in the full-information problem of the best choice.

entry.title: Random dense countable sets: characterization by independence
entry.summary: A random dense countable set is characterized (in distribution) by independence and stationarity. Two examples are `Brownian local minima' and `unordered infinite sample'. They are identically distributed; the former ad hoc proof of this fact is now superseded by a general result.

entry.title: Almost sure asymptotics for a diffusion process in a drifted Brownian potential
entry.summary: We study a one-dimensional diffusion process in a drifted Brownian potential. We characterize the upper functions of its hitting times in the sense of Paul L\'evy, and determine the lower limits in terms of an iterated logarithm law.

entry.title: Large Deviations for Stochastic Generalized Porous Media Equations
entry.summary: The large deviation principle is established for the distributions of a class of generalized stochastic porous media equations for both small noise and short time.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages; BiBoS-Preprint No. 05-11-196; publication in preparation

entry.title: Excited random walk in two dimensions has linear speed
entry.summary: Excited random walk is a process that has a drift to the right whenever it encounters a new vertex. The paper shows that in two dimensions it drifts to the right linearly in time.

entry.title: On Sample Functions Behavior of Stable Processes
entry.summary: We investigate the asymptotic behavior of sample functions of stable processes when $t{\to}\infty$. We compare our results with the iterated logarithm law, results for the first hitting time and most visited sites problems.

entry.title: Heat Kernel Measure on Central Extension of Current Groups in any Dimension
entry.summary: We define measures on central extension of current groups in any dimension by using infinite dimensional Brownian motion.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published in SIGMA (Symmetry, Integrability and Geometry: Methods and Applications) at http://www.emis.de/journals/SIGMA/

entry.title: Integral Criteria for Transportation-Cost Inequalities
entry.summary: In this paper, we provide a characterization of a large class of transportation-cost inequalities in terms of exponential integrability of the cost function under the reference probability measure. Our results completely extend the previous works by Djellout, Guilin and Wu and Bolley and Villani.

entry.title: Configurations of balls in Euclidean space that Brownian motion cannot avoid
entry.summary: We consider a collection of balls in Euclidean space and the problem of determining if Brownian motion has a positive probability of avoiding all the balls
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ann. Acad. Sci. Fenn. Math. 32 (2007), no. 1, 223--234.

entry.title: Reflecting a Langevin Process at an Absorbing Boundary
entry.summary: We consider a Langevin process with white noise random forcing. We suppose that the energy of the particle is instantaneously absorbed when it hits some fixed obstacle. We show that nonetheless, the particle can be instantaneously reflected, and study some properties of this reflecting solution.

entry.title: Correction. Central limit theorems for additive functionals of the simple exclusion process
entry.summary: Correction to Annals of Probability 28 (2000) 277--302 [doi:10.1214/aop/1019160120].
entry.arxiv:comment: Published at http://dx.doi.org/10.1214/009117905000000521 in the Annals of Probability (http://www.imstat.org/aop/) by the Institute of Mathematical Statistics (http://www.imstat.org)

entry.title: Discrete Itô Formulas and Their Applications to Stochastic Numerics
entry.summary: This is a survey note of the author's observations on the discrete-time analogues of It\^o formulas.
entry.arxiv:comment: Based on a talk given at the 7th Workshop on Stochastic Numerics; Jun 27--29, 2005, RIMS, Kyoto

entry.title: Correction. Connect The Dots: How Many Random Points Can A Regular Curve Pass Through?
entry.summary: Correction for Adv. in Appl. Probab. 37, no. 3 (2005), 571-603

entry.title: Maximum principle for SPDEs and its applications
entry.summary: The maximum principle for SPDEs is established in multidimensional $C^{1}$ domains. An application is given to proving the H\"older continuity up to the boundary of solutions of one-dimensional SPDEs.

entry.title: Conditioned Galton-Watson trees do not grow
entry.summary: An example is given which shows that, in general, conditioned Galton-Watson trees cannot be obtained by adding vertices one by one, as has been shown in a special case by Luczak and Winkler.

entry.title: Stein's method for concentration inequalities
entry.summary: We introduce a version of Stein's method for proving concentration and moment inequalities in problems with dependence. Simple illustrative examples from combinatorics, physics, and mathematical statistics are provided.

entry.title: On the Brownian meander and excursion conditioned to have a fixed time average
entry.summary: We study the density of the time average of the Brownian meander/excursion over the time interval [0,1]. Moreover we give an expression for the Brownian meander/excursion conditioned to have a fixed time average.

entry.title: On a random graph related to quantum theory
entry.summary: We show that a random graph studied by Ioffe and Levit is an example of an inhomogeneous random graph of the type studied by Bollobas, Janson and Riordan, which enables us to give a new, simple, proof of their result on a phase transition.

entry.title: Weak Convergence of Laws on R^{K} with Common Marginals
entry.summary: We present a result on topologically equivalent integral metrics (Rachev, 1991, Muller, 1997) that metrize weak convergence of laws with common marginals. This result is relevant for applications, as shown in a few simple examples.

entry.title: A limit theorem of discrete Galton-Watson branching processes with immigration
entry.summary: We provide a simple set of sufficient conditions for the weak convergence of discrete Galton-Watson branching processes with immigration to continuous time and continuous state branching processes with immigration.

entry.title: Branching processes with immigration and related topics
entry.summary: This is a survey on recent progresses in the study of branching processes with immigration, generalized Ornstein-Uhlenbeck processes and affine Markov processes. We mainly focus on the applications of skew convolution semigroups and the connections in those processes.

entry.title: Isotropic random walks on affine buildings
entry.summary: In this paper we apply techniques of spherical harmonic analysis to prove a local limit theorem, a rate of escape theorem, and a central limit theorem for isotropic random walks on arbitrary thick regular affine buildings of irreducible type.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Annales de l'Institut Fourier

entry.title: Random Trees in Electrical Networks
entry.summary: This paper contains results relating currents and voltages in resistive networks to appropriate random trees or forests in those networks.
entry.arxiv:comment: The results are for the most part not new

entry.title: Some thoughts on multiparameter stochastic processes
entry.summary: We suggest to investigate certain non-standard (pseudo-)differential operators in order to construct and to study multi-parameter processes. Our approach will include "classical" multi-parameter Markov processes but will go eventually far beyond.

entry.title: Stationary and Nonequilibrium Fluctuations in Boundary Driven Exclusion Processes
entry.summary: We prove nonequilibrium fluctuations for the boundary driven symmetric simple exclusion process. We deduce from this result the stationary fluctuations.

entry.title: On the Markov property of strong solutions to SDE with generalized coefficients
entry.summary: We show the complete proof of the Markov property of the strong solution to a multidimensional SDE whose coefficients involve local time on a hyperplane of the unknown process.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theory of Stochastic processes, Vol. 11(27), no. 3-4, 2005, pp. 140-146

entry.title: Convexity of the median in the gamma distribution
entry.summary: We show that the median $m(x)$ in the gamma distribution with parameter $x$ is a strictly convex function on the positive half-line

entry.title: Quasipotential and logarithmic asymptotics of the Green's measures
entry.summary: It is proved that the weak large deviation principle of the scaled processes $Z^\eps(t) = \eps Z(t/\eps)$ implies the weak large deviation principle for the scaled Green's measures of the Markov process $Z(t)$.

entry.title: The Curie-Weiss model with dynamical external field
entry.summary: We study a Curie-Weiss model with a random external field generated by a dynamical system. Probabilistic limit theorems (weak law of large numbers, central limit theorems) are proven for the corresponding magnetization.

entry.title: Precise Asymptotics in Chung's law of the iterated logarithm
entry.summary: This paper gives sufficent and necessary conditions on a kind of limit results to hold on the precise convergent rate of an infinite series of probabilities on the Chung type law of the iterated logarithm.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Acta Mathematics Sinica, English Series. Vol 24(2): 631-646,2008

entry.title: On the rates of the other law of the logarithm
entry.summary: By using the strong approximation, this paper establishes several limit results on the convergent rate of a infinite series of probabilities on the other law of iterated logarithm.

entry.title: Revisiting Offspring Maxima in Branching Processes
entry.summary: We present a progress report for studies on maxima related to offspring in branching processes. We summarize and discuss the findings on the subject that appeared in the last ten years. Some of the results are refined and illustrated with new examples.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in PLISKA Studia Mathematica Bulgarica

entry.title: On discretization schemes for stochastic evolution equations
entry.summary: Stochastic evolutional equations with monotone operators are considered in Banach spaces. Explicit and implicit numerical schemes are presented. The convergence of the approximations to the solution of the equations is proved.

entry.title: On the equivalence of some eternal additive coalescents
entry.summary: In this paper, we study additive coalescents. Using their representation as fragmentation processes, we prove that the law of a large class of eternal additive coalescents is absolutely continuous with respect to the law of the standard additive coalescent on any bounded time interval.

entry.title: On homogenization of space-time dependent and degenerate random flows
entry.summary: We study a diffusion process with random space-time dependent coefficients. Moreover the diffusion matrix is allowed to degenerate. An invariance principle is proved provided that the diffusion coefficient is controlled by a time independent one.

entry.title: Random sampling in chirp space
entry.summary: For the space of functions that can be approximated by linear chirps, we prove a reconstruction theorem by random sampling at arbitrary rates.

entry.title: An analogue of the Kubilius main theorem for quasi-logarithmic structures
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author; a revised version is part of the author's phd-thesis "Quasi-logarithmic structures" (Zurich, 2007).

entry.title: One version of the Clark representation theorem for Arratia flow
entry.summary: The article contains description of the functionals from the family of coalescing Brownian particles. New type of the stochastic integral is introduced and used.

entry.title: One Brownian Stochastic Flow
entry.summary: The weak limits of the measure-valued processes organized as a mass carried by the interacting Brownian particles are described. As a limiting flow the Arrattia flow is obtained.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theory of Stochastic Processes.- Vol.10 (26), no. 3-4, 2004, pp. 21-25

entry.title: A note on Talagrand's convex hull concentration inequality
entry.summary: The paper reexamines an argument by Talagrand that leads to a remarkable exponential tail bound for the concentration of probability near a set. The main novelty is the replacement of a mysterious Calculus inequality by an application of Jensen's inequality.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Festschrift for Piet Groeneboom

entry.title: Reflected BSDE with monotonicity and general increasing in $y$, and non-Lipschitz conditions in $z$
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the reflected BSDE with one continuous barrier, under the monotonicity and general increasing condition on $y$ and non Lipschitz condition on $z$. We prove the existence and uniqueness of the solution to these equation by approximation method.

entry.title: A Generalization and Extension of an Autoregressive Model
entry.summary: Generalizations and extensions of a first order autoregressive model of Lawrance and Lewis (1981) are considered and characterized here.

entry.title: The Limiting Spectra of Girko's Block-Matrix
entry.summary: To analyze the limiting spectral distribution of some random block-matrices, Girko [Girko, 2000] uses a system of canonical equations from [Girko, 98]. In this paper, we use the method of moments to give an integral form for the almost sure limiting spectral distribution of such matrices.

entry.title: An arithmetic model for the total disorder process
entry.summary: We prove a multidimensional extension of Selberg's central limit theorem for the logarithm of the Riemann zeta function on the critical line. The limit is a totally disordered process, whose coordinates are all independent and Gaussian.

entry.title: Anticipating Reflected Stochastic Differential Equations
entry.summary: In this paper, we establish the existence of the solutions $ (X, L)$ of reflected stochastic differential equations with possible anticipating initial random variables. The key is to obtain some substitution formula for Stratonovich integrals via a uniform convergence of the corresponding Riemann sums.

entry.title: On a distribution in frequency probability theory corresponding to the Bose-Einstein distribution
entry.summary: The notion of density of a finite set is discussed. We proof a general theorem of set theory which refines Bose-Einstein distribution.

entry.title: Local Strict Comparison Theorem and Converse Comparison Theorems for Reflected Backward Stochastic Differential Equations
entry.summary: A local strict comparison theorem and some converse comparison theorems are proved for reflected backward stochastic differential equations under suitable conditions.

entry.title: A note for extension of almost sure central limit theory
entry.summary: H\"ormann (2006) gave an extension of almost sure central limit theorem for bounded Lipschitz 1 function. In this paper, we show that his result of almost sure central limit theorem is also hold for any Lipschitz function under stronger conditions.

entry.title: Fluctuations of Levy processes and scattering theory
entry.summary: We establish a connection between the scattering inverse problem and the determination of the distribution of the position of the Levy process at the exit time of a bounded interval in term of its Levy exponent.

entry.title: The cutoff phenomenon for randomized riffle shuffles
entry.summary: We study the cutoff phenomenon for generalized riffle shuffles where, at each step, the deck of cards is cut into a random number of packs of multinomial sizes which are then riffled together.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 pages, to be published in Random Structures and Algorithms

entry.title: A combinatorial method for calculating the moments of Lévy area
entry.summary: We present a new way to compute the moments of the L\'evy area of a two-dimensional Brownian motion. Our approach uses iterated integrals and combinatorial arguments involving the shuffle product.

entry.title: Extreme Points of the Convex Set of Joint Probability Distributions with Fixed Marginals
entry.summary: By using a quantum probabilistic approach we obtain a description of the extreme points of the convex set of all joint probability distributions on the product of two standard Borel spaces with fixed marginal distributions.

entry.title: Multidimensional bifractional Brownian motion: Ito and Tanaka formulas
entry.summary: Using the Malliavin calculus with respect to Gaussian processes and the multiple stochastic integrals we derive It\^{o}'s and Tanaka's formulas for the $d$-dimensional bifractional Brownian motion.

entry.title: Random walks and orthogonal polynomials: some challenges
entry.summary: The study of several naturally arising "nearest neighbours" random walks benefits from the study of the associated orthogonal polynomials and their orthogonality measure. I consider extensions of this approach to a larger class of random walks. This raises a number of open problems.

entry.title: Solvability of Backward Stochastic Differential Equations with Quadratic Growth
entry.summary: We prove the existence of the unique solution of a general Backward Stochastic Differential Equation with quadratic growth driven by martingales. Some kind of comparison theorem is also proved.

entry.title: On some special directed last-passage percolation models
entry.summary: We investigate extended processes given by last-passage times in directed models defined using exponential variables with decaying mean. In certain cases we find the universal Airy process, but other cases lead to non-universal and trivial extended processes.

entry.title: Quotient probabilistic normed spaces and completeness results
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of quotient in PN spaces and give some examples. We prove some theorems with regard to the completeness of a quotient.

entry.title: Divisors of Bernoulli sums
entry.summary: We study the asymptotic behavior of the sums of divisors when the integers are modelled with the Bernoulli random walk; We prealably study the correlation properties of the corresponding system.

entry.title: The small deviations of many-dimensional diffusion processes and rarefaction by boundaries
entry.summary: We lead the algorithm of expansion of sojourn probability of many-dimensional diffusion processes in small domain. The principal member of this expansion defines normalizing coefficient for special limit theorems.

entry.title: A new approach to mutual information
entry.summary: A new expression as a certain asymptotic limit via "discrete micro-states" of permutations is provided to the mutual information of both continuous and discrete random variables.

entry.title: Non-monotone convergence in the quadratic Wasserstein distance
entry.summary: We give an easy counter-example to Problem 7.20 from C. Villani's book on mass transport: in general, the quadratic Wasserstein distance between $n$-fold normalized convolutions of two given measures fails to decrease monotonically.

entry.title: Intersection local time for two independent fractional Brownian motions
entry.summary: We prove the existence of the intersection local time for two independent, d -dimensional fractional Brownian motions with the same Hurst parameter H. Assume d greater or equal to 2, then the intersection local time exists if and only if Hd<2.

entry.title: Large deviations of Poisson cluster processes
entry.summary: In this paper we prove scalar and sample path large deviation principles for a large class of Poisson cluster processes. As a consequence, we provide a large deviation principle for ergodic Hawkes point processes.

entry.title: Large deviations for multidimensional SDEs with reflection
entry.summary: The large deviations principles are established for a class of multidimensional degenerate stochastic differential equations with reflecting boundary conditions. The results include two cases where the initial conditions are adapted and anticipated.

entry.title: Reflected backward SDEs with two barriers under monotonicity and general increasing conditions
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove the existence and uniqueness result of the reflected BSDE with two continuous barriers under monotonicity and general increasing condition on $y$, with Lipschitz condition on $z$.

entry.title: Poisson approximation for large clusters in the supercritical FK model
entry.summary: Using the Chen-Stein method, we show that the spatial distribution of large finite clusters in the supercritical FK model approximates a Poisson process when the ratio weak mixing property holds.

entry.title: Regularity of harmonic functions for anisotropic fractional Laplacian
entry.summary: We prove that bounded harmonic functions of anisotropic fractional Laplacians are H\"older continuous under mild regularity assumptions on the corresponding L\'evy measure. Under some stronger assumptions the Green function, Poisson kernel and the harmonic functions are even differentiable of order up to three.

entry.title: Maximal probabilities of convolution powers of discrete uniform distributions
entry.summary: We prove optimal constant over root $n$ upper bounds for the maximal probabilities of $n$th convolution powers of discrete uniform distributions.

entry.title: Law of iterated logarithm for NA sequences with non-identical distributions
entry.summary: Based on a law of the iterated logarithm for independent random variables sequences, an iterated logarithm theorem for NA sequences with non-identical distributions is obtained. The proof is based on a Kolmogrov-type exponential inequality.

entry.title: Stochastic integral representations of quantum martingales on multiple Fock space
entry.summary: In this paper a quantum stochastic integral representation theorem is obtained for unbounded regular martingales with respect to multidimensional quantum noise. This simultaneously extends results of Parthasarathy and Sinha to unbounded martingales and those of the author to multidimensions.

entry.title: The coding complexity of Lévy processes
entry.summary: We investigate the high resolution coding problem for general real-valued L\'evy processes under L^p[0,1]-norm distortion. Tight asymptotic formulas are found under mild regularity assumptions.

entry.title: A Random Change of Variables and Applications to the Stochastic Porous Medium Equation with Multiplicative Time Noise
entry.summary: A change of variables is introduced to reduce certain nonlinear stochastic evolution equations with multiplicative noise to the corresponding deterministic equation. The result is then used to investigate a stochastic porous medium equation.

entry.title: Central limit theorem and almost sure central limit theorem for the product of some partial sums
entry.summary: In this paper, we give the central limit theorem and almost sure central limit theorem for products of some partial sums of independent identically distributed random variables.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. To appear Proceedings of the Indian Academy of Sciences-Mathematical Sciences

entry.title: Self-similar branching Markov chains
entry.summary: The main purpose of this work is to study self-similar branching Markov chains. First we will construct such a process. Then we will establish certain Limit Theorems using the theory of self-similar Markov processes.

entry.title: Dynamics of Jackson networks: perturbation theory
entry.summary: We introduce a new formalism for dealing with networks of queues. The formalism is based on the Doi-Peliti second quantization method for reaction diffusion systems. As a demonstration of the method's utility we compute perturbatively the different time busy-busy correlations between two servers in a Jackson network.

entry.title: A random walk approximation to fractional Brownian motion
entry.summary: We present a random walk approximation to fractional Brownian motion where the increments of the fractional random walk are defined as a weighted sum of the past increments of a Bernoulli random walk.

entry.title: On exit times of Levy-driven Ornstein--Uhlenbeck processes
entry.summary: We prove two martingale identities which involve exit times of Levy-driven Ornstein--Uhlenbeck processes. Using these identities we find an explicit formula for the Laplace transform of the exit time under the assumption that positive jumps of the Levy process are exponentially distributed.

entry.title: Uniqueness of solutions of stochastic differential equations
entry.summary: We consider a d-dimensional stochastic differential equation with additive noise and a drift coefficient which is assumed only to be a bounded Borel function. We show that, for almost all choices of the driving Brownian path, the equation has a unique solution.

entry.title: A new technique for proving uniqueness for martingale problems
entry.summary: A new technique for proving uniqueness of martingale problems is introduced. The method is illustrated in the context of elliptic diffusions in $R^d$.

entry.title: Distributional Limits for the Symmetric Exclusion Process
entry.summary: Strong negative dependence properties have recently been proved for the symmetric exclusion process. In this paper, we apply these results to prove convergence to the Poisson and normal distributions for various functionals of the process.

entry.title: On classifying processes
entry.summary: We prove several results concerning classifications, based on successive observations $(X_1,..., X_n)$ of an unknown stationary and ergodic process, for membership in a given class of processes, such as the class of all finite order Markov chains.

entry.title: Lineage-through-time plots of birth-death processes
entry.summary: We calculate the density and expectation for the number of lineages in a reconstructed tree with $n$ extant species. This is done with conditioning on the age of the tree as well as with assuming a uniform prior for the age of the tree.

entry.title: Markov processes with product-form stationary distribution
entry.summary: We study a class of Markov processes with finite state space and continuous time that have product form stationary distributions. We obtain a number of examples that can generate conjectures for diffusions with inert drift.

entry.title: Duality of Schramm-Loewner Evolutions
entry.summary: In this note, we prove a version of the conjectured duality of Schramm-Loewner Evolutions, by establishing exact identities in distribution between some boundary arcs of chordal $\SLE_\kappa$, $\kappa>4$, and appropriate versions of $\SLE_{\hat\kappa}$, $\hat\kappa=16/\kappa$.

entry.title: Filtrations
entry.summary: In this article, we define the notion of a filtration and then give the basic theorems on initial and progressive enlargements of filtrations.
entry.arxiv:comment: Short article on filtrations for the encyclopaedia of quantitative finance, Wiley

entry.title: Graph limits and exchangeable random graphs
entry.summary: We develop a clear connection between deFinetti's theorem for exchangeable arrays (work of Aldous--Hoover--Kallenberg) and the emerging area of graph limits (work of Lovasz and many coauthors). Along the way, we translate the graph theory into more classical probability.

entry.title: Dimension and natural parametrization for SLE curves
entry.summary: Some possible definitions for the natural parametrization of SLE (Schramm-Loewner evolution) paths are proposed in terms of various limits. One of the definitions is used to give a new proof of the Hausdorff dimension of SLE paths.

entry.title: Game-theoretic Brownian motion
entry.summary: This paper suggests a perfect-information game, along the lines of Levy's characterization of Brownian motion, that formalizes the process of Brownian motion in game-theoretic probability. This is perhaps the simplest situation where probability emerges in a non-stochastic environment.

entry.title: Exponential Bounds in the Law of Iterated Logarithm for Martingales
entry.summary: In this paper non-asymptotic exponential estimates are derived for tail of maximum martingale distribution by naturally norming in the spirit of the classical Law of Iterated Logarithm. Key words: Martingales, exponential estimations, moment, Banach spaces of random variables, tail of distribution, conditional expectation.

entry.title: Upper bounds for transition probabilities on graphs and isoperimetric inequalities
entry.summary: In this paper necessary and sufficient conditions are presented for heat kernel upper bounds for random walks on weighted graphs. Several equivalent conditions are given in the form of isoperimetric inequalities.

entry.title: Random walks on graphs with volume and time doubling
entry.summary: This paper studies the on- and off-diagonal upper estimate and the two-sided transition probability estimate of random walks on weighted graphs.

entry.title: Exact exponential bounds for the random field maximum distribution via the majoring measures (generic chaining)
entry.summary: In this paper non-asymptotic exact exponential estimates are derived for the tail of maximum distribution of random field in the terms of majoring measures or, equally, generic chaining.

entry.title: A uniqueness theorem for solution of BSDEs
entry.summary: In this note, we prove that if $g$ is uniformly continuous in $z$, uniformly with respect to $(\oo,t)$ and independent of $y$, the solution to the backward stochastic differential equation (BSDE) with generator $g$ is unique.

entry.title: Orbit measures and interlaced determinantal point processes
entry.summary: We study some random interlaced configurations considering the eigenvalues of the main minors of Hermitian random matrices of the classical complex Lie algebras. We claim that these random configurations are determinantal and give their correlation kernels.

entry.title: A decomposition of the bifractional Brownian motion and some applications
entry.summary: In this paper we show a decomposition of the bifractional Brownian motion with parameters H,K into the sum of a fractional Brownian motion with Hurst parameter HK plus a stochastic process with absolutely continuous trajectories. Some applications of this decomposition are discussed.

entry.title: Symmetric jump processes: localization, heat kernels, and convergence
entry.summary: We consider symmetric processes of pure jump type. We prove local estimates on the probability of exiting balls, the H\"older continuity of harmonic functions and of heat kernels, and convergence of a sequence of such processes.

entry.title: Estimates of tempered stable densities
entry.summary: Estimates of densities of convolution semigroups of probability measures are given under specific assumptions on the corresponding L\'evy measure and the L\'evy--Khinchin exponent. The assumptions are satisfied, e.g., by tempered stable semigroups of J. Rosi{\'n}ski.

entry.title: Convergence Properties of Kemp's q-Binomial Distribution
entry.summary: We consider Kemp's q-analogue of the binomial distribution. Several convergence results involving the classical binomial, the Heine, the discrete normal, and the Poisson distribution are established. Some of them are q-analogues of classical convergence properties. Besides elementary estimates, we apply Mellin transform asymptotics.

entry.title: The expansion for the overlap function
entry.summary: In this work, it is proved the complete expansion for the second moment of the overlap function for the Sherrington-Kirkpatrick model. It is a technical result which takes advantage of the cavity method and other induction arguments.

entry.title: Random Walk in deterministically changing environment
entry.summary: We consider a random walk with transition probabilities weakly dependent on an environment with a deterministic, but strongly chaotic, evolution. We prove that for almost all initial conditions of the environment the walk satisfies the CLT.

entry.title: A Khasminskii type averaging principle for stochastic reaction-diffusion equations
entry.summary: We prove that an averaging principle holds for a general class of stochastic reaction-diffusion systems, having unbounded multiplicative noise, in any space dimension. We show that the classical Khasminskii approach for systems with a finite number of degrees of freedom can be extended to infinite dimensional systems.

entry.title: A Limit Theorem for Products of Free Unitary Operators
entry.summary: This paper establishes necessary and sufficient conditions for the products of freely independent unitary operators to converge in distribution to the uniform law on the unit circle.

entry.title: Conditions for stochastic integrability in UMD Banach spaces
entry.summary: A detailed theory of stochastic integration in UMD Banach spaces has been developed recently by the authors. The present paper is aimed at giving various sufficient conditions for stochastic integrability.

entry.title: Log-Level Comparison Principle for Small Ball Probabilities
entry.summary: We prove a new variant of comparison principle for logarithmic $L_2$-small ball probabilities of Gaussian processes. As an application, we obtain logarithmic small ball asymptotics for some well-known processes with smooth covariances.

entry.title: On one property of distances in the infinite random quadrangulation
entry.summary: We show that the Schaeffer's tree for an infinite quadrangulation only changes locally when changing the root of the quadrangulation. This follows from one property of distances in the infinite uniform random quadrangulation.

entry.title: On a set of transformations of Gaussian random functions
entry.summary: We consider a set of one-dimensional transformations of Gaussian random functions. Under natural assumptions we obtain a connection between $L_2$-small ball asymptotics of the transformed function and of the original one. Also the explicit Karhunen -- Lo\'eve expansion is obtained for a proper class of Gaussian processes.

entry.title: Density fluctuations for a zero-range process on the percolation cluster
entry.summary: We prove that the density fluctuations for a zero-range process evolving on the supercritical percolation cluster are given by a generalized Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process in the space of distributions $\mc S'(\bb R^d)$.

entry.title: Stability of the LCD Model
entry.summary: In this paper, first-passage probability of Markov chains is used to get a strict proof of the existence of degree distribution of the LCD model presented by Bollobas (Random Structures and Algorithms 18(2001)). Also, a precise expression of degree distribution is presented.

entry.title: On randomly placed arcs on the circle
entry.summary: We completely describe in terms of Hausdorff measures the size of the set of points of the circle that are covered infinitely often by a sequence of random arcs with given lengths. We also show that this set is a set with large intersection.

entry.title: On divergence form SPDEs with VMO coefficients
entry.summary: We present several results on solvability in Sobolev spaces $W^{1}_{p}$ of SPDEs in divergence form in the whole space.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 pages in the original file, 27 pages in the new version, numerous errors corrected

entry.title: Non-perturbative approach to random walk in markovian environment
entry.summary: We prove an averaged CLT for a random walk in a dynamical environment where the states of the environment at different sites are independent Markov chains.

entry.title: Hydrodynamic turbulence and intermittent random fields
entry.summary: In this article, we construct two families of nonsymmetrical multifractal fields. One of these families is used for the modelization of the velocity field of turbulent flows.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 Pages; to appear in Communications in Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Reflected Backward Stochastic Differential Equations with Continuous Coefficient and L^2 Barriers
entry.summary: In this paper we study reflected backward stochastic differential equations with a continuous, linear growth coefficient and two barriers which belong to L^2. We prove that there exists at least by penalization method.

entry.title: Stochastic domination for the last passage percolation model
entry.summary: A competition model on $\mathbb{Z}_+^{2}$ governed by directed last passage percolation is considered. A stochastic domination argument between subtrees of the last passage percolation is put forward.

entry.title: On the strong approximation of non-overlapping m-spacings processes
entry.summary: In this paper we establish strong approximations of the uniform non-overlapping m-spacings process extending the preceding results. Our methods rely on the Mason and Van Zwet's invariance principle.

entry.title: The Hausdorff dimension of the double points on the Brownian frontier
entry.summary: The frontier of a planar Brownian motion is the boundary of the unbounded component of the complement of its range. In this paper we find the Hausdorff dimension of the set of double points on the frontier.

entry.title: On independent sets in purely atomic probability spaces with geometric distribution
entry.summary: We are interested in constructing concrete independent events in purely atomic probability spaces with geometric distribution. Among other facts we prove that there are uncountable many sequences of independent events.

entry.title: Reversibility of chordal SLE
entry.summary: We prove that the chordal SLE$_{\kappa}$ trace is reversible for $\kappa\in(0,4]$.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published in at http://dx.doi.org/10.1214/07-AOP366 the Annals of Probability (http://www.imstat.org/aop/) by the Institute of Mathematical Statistics (http://www.imstat.org)

entry.title: Error calculus and regularity of Poisson functionals : the lent particle method
entry.summary: We propose a new method to apply the Lipschitz functional calculus of local Dirichlet forms to Poisson random measures.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Comptes Rendus de l Acad\'emie des Sciences - Series I - Mathematics, 346 (2008) 779-782

entry.title: Strong solutions of a class of SDEs with jumps
entry.summary: We study a class of stochastic integral equations with jumps under non-Lipschitz conditions. We use the method of Euler approximations to obtain the existence of the solution and give some sufficient conditions for the strong uniqueness.

entry.title: From random walks to rough paths
entry.summary: Donsker's invariance principle is shown to hold for random walks in rough path topology. As application, we obtain Donsker-type weak limit theorems for stochastic integrals and differential equations.

entry.title: Invariance Principle and recurrence for random walks in random environments with zero local drift
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a mistake in one of the main lemmas.

entry.title: Sharp large deviations for the fractional Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process
entry.summary: We investigate the sharp large deviation properties of the energy and the maximum likelihood estimator for the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process driven by a fractional Brownian motion with Hurst index greater than one half.

entry.title: Limit Behaviour of Sequential Empirical Measure Processes
entry.summary: In this paper, we obtain some uniform laws of large numbers and functional central limit theorems for sequential empirical measure processes indexed by classes of product functions satisfying appropriate Vapnik-Chervonenkis properties.

entry.title: Gaussian Correlation Conjecture for Symmetric Convex Sets
entry.summary: Gaussian correlation conjecture states that the Gaussian measure of the intersection of two symmetric convex sets is greater or equal to the product of the measures.
entry.arxiv:comment: This submission has been withdrawn by the author(s)

entry.title: On the laws of first hitting times of points for one-dimensional symmetric stable Lévy processes
entry.summary: Several aspects of the laws of first hitting times of points are investigated for one-dimensional symmetric stable L\'evy processes. It\^o's excursion theory plays a key role in this study.

entry.title: Finite time extinction for solutions to fast diffusion stochastic porous media equations
entry.summary: We prove that the solutions to fast diffusion stochastic porous media equations have finite time extinction with strictly positive probability.

entry.title: The two uniform infinite quadrangulations of the plane have the same law
entry.summary: We prove that the uniform infinite random quadrangulations defined respectively by Chassaing-Durhuus and Krikun have the same distribution.
entry.arxiv:comment: English version of arXiv:0805.4687, with various improvements
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ann. Inst. H. Poincar\'e Probab. Statist. Volume 46, Number 1 (2010), 190-208

entry.title: Supermartingale Deomposition with General Index Set
entry.summary: We prove results on the existence of Dol\'{e}ans-Dade measures and of the Doob-Meyer decomposition for supermartingales indexed by a general index set

entry.title: Orthogonality and probability: beyond nearest neighbor transitions
entry.summary: In this article, we will explore why Karlin-McGregor method of using orthogonal polynomials in the study of Markov processes was so successful for one dimensional nearest neighbor processes, but failed beyond nearest neighbor transitions. We will proceed by suggesting and testing possible fixtures.

entry.title: General discrete random walk with variable absorbing probabilities
entry.summary: We obtain expected number of arrivals, probability of arrival, absorption probabilities and expected time before absorption for a general discrete random walk with variable absorbing probabilities on a finite interval using Fibonacci numbers

entry.title: Approximation of target problems in Blackwell spaces
entry.summary: On a weakly Blackwell space we show how to define a Markov chain approximating problem, for the target problem. The approximating problem is proved to converge to the optimal reduced problem under different pseudometrics. A computational example of compression of information is discussed.

entry.title: Exact Asymptotic for the Tail of Maximum of Smooth Random Field Distribution
entry.summary: We obtain in this paper using the saddle point method the expression for the exact asymptotic for the tail of maximum of smooth (twice continuous differentiable) random field (process) distribution.

entry.title: Condenser physics applied to Markov chains - A brief introduction to potential theory
entry.summary: These notes constitute the introduction to potential theory I exposed at the XIIth brazilian school of probability inside Elisabetta Scoppola's Introduction to Metastability.

entry.title: From the long jump random walk to the fractional Laplacian
entry.summary: This note illustrates how a simple random walk with possibly long jumps is related to fractional powers of the Laplace operator. The exposition is elementary and self-contained.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to the Probability Surveys (http://www.i-journals.org/ps/) by the Institute of Mathematical Statistics (http://www.imstat.org)

entry.title: A note on adiabatic theorem for Markov chains and adiabatic quantum computation
entry.summary: We derive an adiabatic theorem for Markov chains using well known facts about mixing and relaxation times. We discuss the results in the context of the recent developments in adiabatic quantum computation.

entry.title: Random symmetrizations of measurable sets
entry.summary: In this paper we prove almost sure convergence to the ball, in the Nikodym metric, of sequences of random Steiner symmetrizations of bounded Caccioppoli and bounded measurable sets, paralleling a result due to Mani-Levitska concerning convex bodies.

entry.title: About Gaussian filtering problems with general exponential quadratic criteria
entry.summary: Filtering problems with general exponential quadratic criteria are investigated for Gauss-Markov processes. In this setting, the Linear Exponential Gaussian and Risk-Sensitive filtering problems are solved and it is shown that they may have different solutions.

entry.title: Extremes of Levy processes with light tails
entry.summary: We give conditions under which the tail probability of the supremum over unit interval of a Levy process with light tail is equivalent to the tail of the value of the process at the right endpoint.

entry.title: An almost sure energy inequality for Markov solutions to the 3D Navier-Stokes equations
entry.summary: We prove existence of weak martingale solutions satisfying an almost sure version of the energy inequality and which constitute a (almost sure) Markov process.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted for the proceedings of the conference "Stochastic partial differential equations and applications VIII"

entry.title: A Single Server Retrial Queue with Different Types of Server Interruptions
entry.summary: We consider a single server retrial queue with the server subject to interruptions and classical retrial policy for the access from the orbit to the server. We analyze the equilibrium distribution of the system and obtain the generating functions of the limiting distribution.

entry.title: Stochastic approach for the subordination in Bochner sense
entry.summary: It is possible to construct a double indexed process with sample paths a surface of a family of subordinators obtained by subordination. We study here a branch of this subordination process. This opens martingale methods on symbolic calculus questions.

entry.title: On the re-rooting invariance property of Levy trees
entry.summary: We prove a strong form of the invariance under re-rooting of the distribution of the continuous random trees called Levy trees. This extends previous results due to several authors.

entry.title: Motion in a Random Force Field
entry.summary: We consider the motion of a particle in a random isotropic force field. Assuming that the force field arises from a Poisson field in $\mathbb{R}^d$, $d \geq 4$, and the initial velocity of the particle is sufficiently large, we describe the asymptotic behavior of the particle.

entry.title: Metastability for Non-Linear Random Perturbations of Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: In this paper we describe the long time behavior of solutions to quasi-linear parabolic equations with a small parameter at the second order term and the long time behavior of corresponding diffusion processes.

entry.title: Zero bias transformation and asymptotic expansions
entry.summary: We apply the zero bias transformation to deduce a recursive asymptotic expansion formula for expectation of functions of sum of independent random variables in terms of normal expectations and we discuss the remainder term estimations.

entry.title: Amenability of horocyclic products of percolation trees
entry.summary: For horocyclic products of percolation subtrees of regular trees, we show almost sure amenability. Under a symmetry condition concerning the growth of the two percolation trees, we show the existence of an increasing Foelner sequence (which we call strong amenability).

entry.title: Hydrostatics and dynamical large deviations of boundary driven gradient symmetric exclusion
entry.summary: We prove hydrostatics of boundary driven gradient exclusion processes, Fick's law and we present a simple proof of the dynamical large deviations principle which holds in any dimension

entry.title: Risk-averse asymptotics for reservation prices
entry.summary: An investor's risk aversion is assumed to tend to infinity. In a fairly general setting, we present conditions ensuring that the respective utility indifference prices of a given contingent claim converge to its super replication price.

entry.title: Hoeffding spaces and Specht modules
entry.summary: It is proved that each Hoeffding space associated with a random permutation (or, equivalently, with extractions without replacement from a finite population) carries an irreducible representation of the symmetric group, equivalent to a two-block Specht module.

entry.title: Zero bias transformation and asymptotic expansions II : the Poisson case
entry.summary: We apply a discrete version of the methodology in \cite{gauss} to obtain a recursive asymptotic expansion for $\esp[h(W)]$ in terms of Poisson expectations, where $W$ is a sum of independent integer-valued random variables and $h$ is a polynomially growing function. We also discuss the remainder estimations.

entry.title: Remarks on the fractional Brownian motion
entry.summary: We study the fBm by use of convolution of the standard white noise with a certain distribution. This brings some simplifications and new results.

entry.title: A Supplement to the Paper Poisson Approximation in a Poisson Limit Theorem Inspired by Coupon Collecting
entry.summary: In this note we give a proof for the result stated as Theorem 4 in Poisson Approximation in a Poisson Limit Theorem Inspired by Coupon Collecting.

entry.title: Random walk on the integers with equidistant multiple function barriers
entry.summary: We obtain expected number of arrivals, probability of arrival, absorption probabilities and expected time before absorption for a discrete random walk on the integers with an infinite set of equidistant multiple function barriers

entry.title: Erratum: Percolation on random Johnson-Mehl tessellations and related models
entry.summary: We correct a simple error in Percolation on random Johnson-Mehl tessellations and related models, Probability Theory and Related Fields 140 (2008), 417-468. (See also arXiv:math/0610716)

entry.title: On small balls problem for stable measures in a Hilbert space
entry.summary: In the paper the old results on probabilities of small balls for stable measures in a Hilbert space, obtained in 1977 and remaining unpublished, are presented. Apart of historical value these results are interesting even now, since they are comparable with recently obtained ones.

entry.title: Cumulants as iterated integrals
entry.summary: A formula expressing cumulants in terms of iterated integrals of the distribution function is derived. It generalizes results of Jones and Balakrishnan who computed expressions for cumulants up to order 4.

entry.title: Cumulants of a convolution and applications to monotone probability theory
entry.summary: The contents are divided into two papers "The Monotone Cumulants" (arXiv:0907.4896) and "Conditionally monotone independence" (arXiv:0907.5473).

entry.title: Ergodic Properties of Max-Infinitely Divisible Processes
entry.summary: We prove that a stationary max--infinitely divisible process is mixing (ergodic) iff its dependence function converges to 0 (is Cesaro summable to 0). These criteria are applied to some classes of max--infinitely divisible processes.

entry.title: Rate of convergence of stochastic processes with values in $\mathbb{R}$-trees and Hadamard manifolds
entry.summary: Under K.-T. Sturm's formulation, we obtain a Gaussian upper bound for tail probability of mean value of independent, identically distributed random variables with values in $\mathbb{R}$-trees and Hadamard manifolds.

entry.title: Conformal invariance and universal critical exponents in the two-dimensional percolation model
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial sign error in Proposition 3.1.

entry.title: An extension of the Yamada-Watanabe condition for pathwise uniqueness to stochastic differential equations with jumps
entry.summary: We extend the Yamada-Watanabe condition for pathwise uniqueness to stochastic differential equations with jumps, in the special case where small jumps are summable.

entry.title: Characteristic Polynomials of Sample Covariance Matrices
entry.summary: We investigate the second-order correlation function of the characteristic polynomial of a sample covariance matrix. Starting from an explicit formula for the generating function, we re-obtain several well-known kernels from random matrix theory.

entry.title: Central Limit Theorem for Coloured Hard-Dimers
entry.summary: Using an averaged generating function for coloured hard-dimers, some random variables of interest are studied. The main result lies in the fact that all their probability distributions obey a central limit theorem.

entry.title: Hsu-Robbins and Spitzer's theorems for the variations of fractional Brownian motion
entry.summary: Using recent results on the behavior of multiple Wiener-It\^o integrals based on Stein's method, we prove Hsu-Robbins and Spitzer's theorems for sequences of correlated random variables related to the increments of the fractional Brownian motion.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in "Electronic Communications in Probability"
